original: tshe 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos na yang blo mi brtan zhing mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gzhan gyi kha phyin par 'gyur te /

translated: In this life, even if they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, their minds will be unstable and they will be led by the words of others, nonvirtuous friends.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klag pa dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba mi nus par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //

translated: They will be unable to write out, read aloud, explain, chant, or properly pay attention to this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi 'dri zhing lung mi 'bogs pa dang / kha ton mi byed cing tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed la /

translated: Subh≈´ti, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who do not write out this profound perfection of wisdom, do not take it up, do not read it aloud, do not explain it, do not chant it, do not properly pay attention to it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis gzhan la phan mi 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /

original: pha rol yang mi shes te /üîΩsbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su ma bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ste /
analyzed: pha rol yang mi shes te / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su ma bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ste /
translated: and does not know the other shore.üîΩBecause they are not held by the perfection of giving, and so on up to: because they are not held by the knowledge of all aspects, they fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,üîΩand do not come forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar thabs dang mi ldan par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag la rlom sems su byed na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar thabs dang mi ldan par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag la rlom sems su byed na /
translated: This passage from ‚ÄúBecause they are not held by the perfection of giving‚Äù up to ‚Äúthey do not come forth to the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù shows that if, without skill in means, they practice the six perfections and have impure three spheres, they are conceited.

original: pha rol tu @127b phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang mi ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu @127b phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang mi ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels and do not emerge to omniscience because they do not possess the qualities of purification, such as the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how is it that persons in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, who are held by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, do not fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha levels,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and how is it that they accomplish unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBecause they are held by the knowledge of paths, they do not fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are held by the knowledge of all aspects, they do not fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas par ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa rnams bdag dang bdag gir mi
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas par ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa rnams bdag dang bdag gir mi
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúThey do not apprehend a self or a sentient being‚Äù up to ‚Äúthey will accomplish omniscience‚Äù explains that bodhisattvas who possess the perfection of wisdom and skillful means and who practice the six perfections do not apprehend a self or a sentient being.

original: 'dzin cing / don dam par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang dngos po med par rtogs la /
analyzed: 'dzin cing / don dam par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang dngos po med par rtogs la /
translated: They realize that ultimately the perfections do not exist as things.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rlom sems med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rlom sems med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod na /
translated: But conventionally, through their skillful means, they do not apprehend the perfections as signs and without conceit they practice the six perfections and so forth.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi don dang ldan zhing don de rnams kyis yongs su zin pas bar ma dor nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi don dang ldan zhing don de rnams kyis yongs su zin pas bar ma dor nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: Since they possess the meaning of the phenomena of complete purification, such as the six perfections, and are fully endowed with that meaning, they do not fall into the way of the ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas in the interim.

original: kyang 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kyang 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: and also the teaching of the establishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: Subhuti, thus the person who is in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, who is taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, who is taken hold of by skill in means,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: up to ‚Äúdoes not fall to the level of the Sravakas or Pratyekabuddhas‚Äù is the conclusion of the meaning explained above.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la sogs pas yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la sogs pas yongs su bzung na /
translated: Thus, if one is taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, skill in means, and so on,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar bar ma dor mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar bar ma dor mi ltung zhing /
translated: one does not fall to the level of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas in the interval,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.
Subhuti,

original: 'byor ji ltar na gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'byor ji ltar na gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: How is it that a person who is a bodhisattva vehicle practitioner is completely taken hold of by skillful means?

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa'i tshe /üîΩ'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing rlom sems med pa rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par bstan pa'i don gong du bshad pa nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis zhib
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa'i tshe / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing rlom sems med pa rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par bstan pa'i don gong du bshad pa nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis zhib
translated: When bodhisattvas who possess skillful means practice the six perfections and so forth,üîΩthey practice with the three spheres completely pure and without conceit.

original: tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the above explanation is explained in detail by another method:

original: rab 'byor 'di la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa thog mar thabs dang ldan par sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa thog mar thabs dang ldan par sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, here a person who is a bodhisattva vehicle practitioner first gives gifts with skillful means.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing de dag gis rlom sems mi byed pa
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing de dag gis rlom sems mi byed pa
translated: The passage from I am practicing generosity up to I am endowed with wisdom shows that the bodhisattva who is endowed with skillful means practices the six perfections with the three spheres completely pure and does not become conceited by them.

original: bstan to // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bstan to // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag med de /
analyzed: de ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag med de /
translated: Thus, because of nonconceptuality, those concepts about the perfection of generosity do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di lta ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di lta ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is because there is no perfection of generosity, up to there is no perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing rlom sems su mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod cing rlom sems su mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from that perfection of generosity up to that perfection of wisdom shows the reason for practicing with the three spheres completely pure and not becoming conceited.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa la yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa la yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: The bodhisattva's practice of generosity and so forth is also free from such conceptualization.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang don dam par dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang don dam par dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: And since the six perfections are ultimately not entities, they are not objects of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing rlom sems med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing rlom sems med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that they are completely pure of the three spheres and free from conceit.üîΩAnd yet, the person who is a bodhisattva vehicle practitioner also knows that it is far advanced, and although they know the other side, they are not conceited about it.

original: de lta yang yin la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de yang ring du song ba'ang shes shing pha rol shes kyang des rlom sems med de de zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas rnam par rtog pa dangüîΩbrtag par bya ba gnyis ka med de /
analyzed: de lta yang yin la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de yang ring du song ba'ang shes shing pha rol shes kyang des rlom sems med de de zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas rnam par rtog pa dang brtag par bya ba gnyis ka med de /
translated: That means that since all phenomena are empty by nature, both conceptualization and the object of conceptualization do not exist.

original: rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das te ring du song ba shes kyang shes pa de mi bsnyems so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das te ring du song ba shes kyang shes pa de mi bsnyems so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Having transcended the domain of conceptualization, it is taught that although they know that it is far advanced, they do not exalt that knowledge.

original: de sbyin pa'i @128b pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i @128b pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is because they are held by the perfection of generosity, and so on, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
translated: they are held by the knowledge of all aspects, they do not fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: but emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing rlom sems med na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi don dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing rnam pa thams
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing rlom sems med na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi don dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing rnam pa thams
translated: Thus, as explained above, if the three spheres are completely pure and there is no conceit, then because they are endowed with the meaning of the purifying dharmas, such as the six perfections, they do not fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, and they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the benefits.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu drug pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu drug pa'o /
translated: This was the thirty-sixth chapter in the great commentary on the perfection of wisdom in ten thousand lines, called The Perfection of Wisdom Explained in Detail.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas par mi ldan na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas par ldan na /
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas par mi ldan na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas par ldan na /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord: So it is, Lord, so it is, Well-Gone!üîΩ Thus, having heard the explanation that if one is not endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skill in means, one will fall to the level of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, but if one is endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skill in means,üîΩone will not fall to the level of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, Subhuti thought, Well then, how should those who have newly entered the vehicle, who are not endowed with wisdom and means, train in the six perfections?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bshad pa thos pa dang / 'o na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa shes rab dang thabs su mi ldan pa dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar bslab par bya snyam nas zhus pa'o //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bshad pa thos pa dang / 'o na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa shes rab dang thabs su mi ldan pa dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar bslab par bya snyam nas zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Lord said: Subhuti, those Bodhisattvas, those great beings who wish to train in the perfection of giving should listen to this perfection of wisdom, study it, bear it in mind, recite it, learn it, and wisely attend to it.üîΩThey should revere, honor, and worship it with flowers, etc.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag bsnyen par bya'o //üîΩbrten par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag bsnyen par bya'o //üîΩbrten par bya'o //
translated: Those who teach the perfection of giving should be attended upon, should be served.

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las dang po pa rnams kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston pa'i mkhas pa la bsnyen cing bsnyen bkur byas te bslabs na thabs mkhas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las dang po pa rnams kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston pa'i mkhas pa la bsnyen cing bsnyen bkur byas te bslabs na thabs mkhas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúshould serve‚Äù teaches that if beginners serve and attend upon a spiritual friend who is skilled in teaching the six perfections, and train themselves, they will become skilled in means,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and will accomplish unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without falling into the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de dag de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThey teach this perfection of wisdom to them like this‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar ston cing 'chad pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar ston cing 'chad pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches the way in which those spiritual friends teach and explain the six perfections.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla @129a * //
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla @129a * //
translated: ‚ÄúCome, son of good family! Whatever generosity you give, all of that‚Ä¶

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces bya ba nas /
translated: and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu shes rab gang dang gang bsgoms pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu shes rab gang dang gang bsgoms pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: From Come here, son of good family! Whatever wisdom you cultivate, dedicate all of it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. up to ...

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi bsngo bar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi bsngo bar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the method of dedicating the results of practicing the six perfections to unsurpassed enlightenment, without dedicating them to the mundane perfections or to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs su rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs su rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba nas /
translated: Son of good family, do not conceive unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment as form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtog par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: From ... up to 'do not conceive it as the knowledge of all aspects.'

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin pa'i phyir chos de dag gi rang
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin pa'i phyir chos de dag gi rang
translated: Since unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment itself is ultimately a non-entity, it is not the nature of any phenomenon from form up to omniscience.

original: bzhin du mi brtag cing mtshan mar mi bzung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin du mi brtag cing mtshan mar mi bzung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one should not impute it as the nature of those phenomena and should not apprehend it as a sign.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs su ma brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba nas yongs su ma brtags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
analyzed: yongs su ma brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba nas yongs su ma brtags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
translated: The passage from ‚Äúunimagined form causes the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù up to ‚Äúunimagined knowledge of aspects of the path causes the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù

original: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mi brtag cing mtshan mar mi bzung ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mi brtag cing mtshan mar mi bzung ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the reasoning that unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment should not be imputed as the nature of form and so forth and should not be apprehended as a sign.

original: don dam par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang dngos po med de brtag pa'i yul ma yin pas de dag la yongs su ma brtags shing mtshan mar ma bzung na yang dag pa'i don
analyzed: don dam par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang dngos po med de brtag pa'i yul ma yin pas de dag la yongs su ma brtags shing mtshan mar ma bzung na yang dag pa'i don
translated: In the ultimate truth, the very highest, complete enlightenment and all phenomena such as form and so forth are not entities, and since they are not objects of investigation, if they are not investigated and not apprehended as signs, that is the realization of the perfect meaning.

original: rtogs pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one will attain omniscience.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod gzugs la 'dod pa ma skyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod gzugs la 'dod pa ma skyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, do not give rise to desire for form. And why?üîΩSon of noble family, form is without desire.

original: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni gzugs so zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma skyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni gzugs so zhes bya ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma skyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, do not give rise to desire for the very highest, complete enlightenment. And why?

original: @129b rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: @129b rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Son of noble family, the very highest, complete enlightenment is without desire.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang yongs su ma brtags shing dang mtshan mar ma bzung na /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang yongs su ma brtags shing dang mtshan mar ma bzung na /
translated: Thus, if it is explained that ‚Äúone will attain the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù when one does not fully investigate any phenomenon, such as form, and does not apprehend it as a sign,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bshad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i dngos por rtog cing de la 'dod pa skyed pa dgag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bshad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i dngos por rtog cing de la 'dod pa skyed pa dgag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: then this teaches the refutation of the conception of a thing that is to be attained, the knowledge of all aspects, and the generation of desire for it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: ‚Äú Phenomena, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, do not ultimately exist as things.

original: 'dod par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pas de la 'dod pa ma skyed cig ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pas de la 'dod pa ma skyed cig ces bstan pa'o //
translated: Do not generate desire for them, since they are not things to be desired.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Son of noble family, all phenomena are empty by their very nature.‚Äù This is a summary of the meaning explained above.

original: mdor na chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong bas chos gang yang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa mi skyed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong bas chos gang yang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa mi skyed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief, it teaches that since all phenomena are ultimately empty of essence, one should not give rise to desire for any phenomenon in order to attain it.üîΩThus have I heard, etc.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas gang la 'dod pa bskyed du med la /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas gang la 'dod pa bskyed du med la /
translated: Since all phenomena are ultimately empty of essence, as explained above, one should not give rise to desire for anything.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par smon lam 'debs shing mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de dag de ltar dngos po med na ni smon cing 'dod par bya ba'ang mi rigs /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par smon lam 'debs shing mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de dag de ltar dngos po med na ni smon cing 'dod par bya ba'ang mi rigs /
translated: But those who aspire to attain unsurpassable complete enlightenment and wish to become fully enlightened should not aspire to and desire something that does not exist.

original: de ste dngos po zhig yod na ni mi smon cing 'dod pa mi bskyed pa mi rig pa las /
analyzed: de ste dngos po zhig yod na ni mi smon cing 'dod pa mi bskyed pa mi rig pa las /
translated: If it did exist, it would not be right to not aspire to and not give rise to desire for it.

original: smon cing 'dod pa skyed pa ni 'gal bar byed pa'o zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: smon cing 'dod pa skyed pa ni 'gal bar byed pa'o zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: To aspire and give rise to desire is to create a contradiction.

original: rab 'byor 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur rig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ste zhes bya ba nas /üîΩ'ji rten gyi lam du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad stong @130a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur rig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ste zhes bya ba nas / 'ji rten gyi lam du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don dam par chos thams cad stong @130a * //
translated: Subh≈´ti, however, the great bodhisattvas, having realized that all phenomena are like illusions and like dreams, set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: par rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams drang zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: par rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams drang zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur rtogs par bya ste /
translated: From ...in order to make the worldly path up to ...set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, it is taught that although one realizes all phenomena as empty in ultimate truth, in order to guide and benefit sentient beings conventionally, one should realize that all phenomena are like illusions and dreams.

original: de la ma chags par sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma chags par sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Without attachment to that, one should benefit sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon dang / skyabs dang / rten dang / dpung gnyen dang / gling dang / snang ba dang / sgron ma 'dzin pa dang / 'od 'byin pa dang / ded dpon dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon dang / skyabs dang / rten dang / dpung gnyen dang / gling dang / snang ba dang / sgron ma 'dzin pa dang / 'od 'byin pa dang / ded dpon dang /
translated: the world‚Äôs benefit, benefit, happiness, protector, refuge, support, ally, island, light, holder of the lamp, giver of light, caravan leader,

original: yongs su 'dren pa dang / lam du 'gyur bar bya ba'i tshig rnams ni 'og nas gzhung nyid las zhib tu bshad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa dang / lam du 'gyur bar bya ba'i tshig rnams ni 'og nas gzhung nyid las zhib tu bshad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: and guide. The words that are to be applied to the explanation below in the text are:

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings, wanting to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'jig rten gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and having set out for the world‚Äôs benefit,

original: shes rab ci bsgom pa de dag thams cad kyang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal yongs su sgrol ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ci bsgom pa de dag thams cad kyang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal yongs su sgrol ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that they are correctly engaged for the sake of the world.

original: byang chub sems dpas don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Although bodhisattvas realize that ultimately all phenomena are empty, they practice the six perfections in order to eliminate the suffering of sentient beings on the conventional level.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, how are bodhisattva great beings correctly engaged for the sake of the world?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'gro ba'i rgyud lnga nas yongs su bton cing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god de zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'gro ba'i rgyud lnga nas yongs su bton cing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god de zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang
translated: Here, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, having extracted sentient beings from the five destinies, establishes them in the happy state of nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is a place of fearlessness.

original: dag par zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dag par zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that he is engaged for the benefit of the world.

original: sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba nas bton te /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba nas bton te /
translated: Having extracted sentient beings from the cyclic existence of the five destinies,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la 'god par byed pa na 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la 'god par byed pa na 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: when he establishes them in the happy state of nirvƒÅ·πáa, he is engaged for the benefit of the world.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs @130b pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs @130b pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, how is it that the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva is engaged for the happiness of the world?

original: 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthey are liberated from the conflicts‚Äù up to ‚Äúthey are established in the bliss of nirvana, the state of fearlessness‚Äù teaches the bodhisattvas‚Äô engagement for the world‚Äôs happiness.

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las thabs sna tshogs kyis thar par byas te /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las thabs sna tshogs kyis thar par byas te /
translated: By means of various methods, they liberate sentient beings from the sufferings, mental unhappiness, and conflicts of cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'god pa ni 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'god pa ni 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And they establish them in the state of nirvana. This is the teaching on the bodhisattvas‚Äô engagement for the world‚Äôs happiness.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening act as protectors for the world?‚Äù

original: sems can de dag kyang thos te thos nas rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya nga las 'das par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang thos te thos nas rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya nga las 'das par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: And those sentient beings hear them, and having heard them, they gradually attain nirvana through the three vehicles.

original: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyi nang gi sdug bsngal ci yod pa thams cad bskyabs shing bsal te dga' bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyi nang gi sdug bsngal ci yod pa thams cad bskyabs shing bsal te dga' bar byas nas /
translated: Having protected and dispelled all the inner and outer sufferings of sentient beings who remain in cyclic existence, and having delighted them,üîΩhaving delighted them and having explained the holy Dharma to them and ripened them, they cause them to attain nirvana through the three vehicles of emancipation.

original: dga' bar gyur pa dang / de dag la dam pa'i chos bshad de yongs su smin par byas nas thar pa'i theg pa gsum la mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa gsum la mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa ni 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur pa dang / de dag la dam pa'i chos bshad de yongs su smin par byas nas thar pa'i theg pa gsum la mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa gsum la mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa ni 'jig rten gyi mgon byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the protector of the world is finished.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, how is it that the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, becomes a refuge for the world?

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skyabs su gyur pa bstan pa ste /üîΩ'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i chos can rnams skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa med par byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la 'god pa'i bde ba la 'god pa ni 'jig rten gyi
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skyabs su gyur pa bstan pa ste / 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i chos can rnams skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa med par byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la 'god pa'i bde ba la 'god pa ni 'jig rten gyi
translated: From here up to he delivers them from the realm of nirvana without remainder, this shows how he becomes a refuge.

original: skyabs su gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that he becomes a refuge for the world by establishing beings who dwell in sa·πÉsƒÅra, who possess the qualities of birth, aging, and so forth, in the bliss of complete nirvana by eliminating birth, aging, and so forth.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @131a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @131a * //
translated: Subh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: 'dod pa sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening become a support for beings?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams
translated: Subh≈´ti, here bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening teach the Dharma without mixing up all dharmas.‚Äù

original: kyi rten du gyur pa'i don mdor bshad pa ste /
analyzed: kyi rten du gyur pa'i don mdor bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the brief explanation of the meaning of ‚Äúsupport for beings.‚Äù

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis dben pas mtshan nyid ma 'dres shing gang dang yang 'brel pa med par chos ston pa ni don dam pa'i dbyings la mi brten pa'i tshul gyis brten pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis dben pas mtshan nyid ma 'dres shing gang dang yang 'brel pa med par chos ston pa ni don dam pa'i dbyings la mi brten pa'i tshul gyis brten pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur
translated: Since ultimately all phenomena are non-entities and devoid of intrinsic nature, the teaching of the Dharma with distinct characteristics and without any connection is the support for sentient beings in the manner of not relying on the ultimate expanse.

original: pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to zhes bshad pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to zhes bshad pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: He said, Blessed One, how is it that all phenomena are not mixed? This is the request to explain in detail the meaning of the explanation above that the Dharma is taught with all phenomena being unmixed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'brel pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'brel pa gang yang med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the non-connection of form is the non-connection of form with anything at all‚Äù and so on explains in detail the meaning of the non-connection of all phenomena.

original: don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing rang bzhin gyis dben pa ni so so'i mtshan nyid gang dang gang ma 'dres pas de dang 'brel pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing rang bzhin gyis dben pa ni so so'i mtshan nyid gang dang gang ma 'dres pas de dang 'brel pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ultimate, all phenomena being empty of their own entities and devoid of intrinsic nature, are not connected with anything at all because their individual characteristics are not mixed up with each other. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs kyi 'brel ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'brel ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-connection of form is the non-arising of form‚Äù teaches that form is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: gang dang yang ma 'brel ba de nyid skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang yang ma 'brel ba de nyid skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is not connected with anything at all is the nature of non-arising.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba med na 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba med na 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The non-production of form is the non-cessation of form. This means that if there is no production, there is also no cessation.

original: gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-cessation of form is the non-confusion of form.

original: de ltar skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa ni dngos po med pas gang dang yang 'dres par mi 'gyur te rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa ni dngos po med pas gang dang yang 'dres par mi 'gyur te rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no production and no cessation, there is no entity, and therefore there is no confusion with anything. It is taught that [form] is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du @131b yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du @131b yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it was explained for form, so it should be applied to feeling and so forth up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Subh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas become a refuge for sentient beings, wishing to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?

original: pas ni 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pas ni 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth explains being a refuge for the world.

original: sems can rnams chos rnams kyi chos nyid mi shes shing /
analyzed: sems can rnams chos rnams kyi chos nyid mi shes shing /
translated: Sentient beings do not know the dharmatƒÅ of phenomena.

original: mgon skyabs med pa la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la ma nor bar chos bstan na /
analyzed: mgon skyabs med pa la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la ma nor bar chos bstan na /
translated: For those without a protector or refuge, if bodhisattvas, just as they themselves have realized the dharmatƒÅ of phenomena, teach the Dharma to sentient beings without error,

original: sems can rnams de dag bdud dang bgegs kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar grogs byas shing bstangs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams de dag bdud dang bgegs kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar grogs byas shing bstangs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: then sentient beings will be assisted and served, not coming under the power of mƒÅras and obstacles. Therefore, they become a refuge.

original: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnams kyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos bstan na /üîΩsems can rnams kyis chos kyi chos nyid don dam pa'i dbyings rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnams kyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos bstan na / sems can rnams kyis chos kyi chos nyid don dam pa'i dbyings rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the teaching of the Dharma that the nature of the reality of phenomena is the ultimate realm,

original: bdud kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and it is the protector of beings, because they do not come under the power of the demons.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: As form has been explained, so should feeling, etc. be applied up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhuti: As form, so all dharmas.

original: don dam par gzugs dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas rang bzhin tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas rang bzhin tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that ultimately form and all dharmas are of one taste in emptiness, and therefore have no different natures.

original: gsol pa / gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ji ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: gsol pa / gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ji ltar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIf the Lord has said that all phenomena are just like form,

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then, Lord, it is as if the bodhisattva great being has fully awakened to all phenomena.

original: gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang de bzhin na gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad kyang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang de bzhin na gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad kyang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If all phenomena are just like form, then by realizing just form all phenomena would be realized.

original: de lta yin na gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor gyis @132a * //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor gyis @132a * //
translated: If that were so, then by realizing just form, the knowledge of all aspects would be attained.‚Äù

original: gal bzung ste gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gal bzung ste gsol pa'o //
translated: This is what Subh≈´ti is saying.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bar gal bzung ste gsol pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bar gal bzung ste gsol pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
translated: With this and the rest, he is requesting that by realizing just form, all phenomena will be realized.üîΩHe explains the reason:

original: kun rdzob tu ni gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gzugs 'ba' zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOn the conventional level, by realizing just form, all phenomena will not be realized.

original: don dam par ni gzugs kyi pha rol zhes bya ba gzugs kyi mtha' stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni gzugs kyi pha rol zhes bya ba gzugs kyi mtha' stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
translated: But on the ultimate level, what is called ‚Äòbeyond form‚Äô refers to the nature of emptiness, the limit of form.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: That is not the domain of conceptualization.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med par shes na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa med par shes na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one knows it in that way, without conceptualization, one will fully and completely realize all phenomena.‚Äù

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, it should be applied in the same way to all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is feeling.üîΩUp to: This is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bgyi ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol pa /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bgyi ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol pa /
translated: There is no conceptualization at all.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtha' pha rol zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang med pa'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtha' pha rol zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang med pa'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other side of form‚Äù refers to emptiness. The phrase ‚Äúthere is no conceptualization‚Äù indicates the object of observation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is no conceptualization at all on the other side of form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig de nyid bzlas te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig de nyid bzlas te /
translated: Up to: There is no conceptualization on the other side of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa pha rol zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa pha rol zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang yang med pa bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The Buddha replied, It is true that there is no conceptualization at all of 'the other side' of form and so on, that is, of emptiness.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //üîΩ'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so // 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is form,üîΩthis is feeling, and so on up to this is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: There is no conceptualization at all.

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes bshad pa rnam par rtog pa'i thabs ji ltar rtogs pa rnams med pa'i dmigs @132b bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes bshad pa rnam par rtog pa'i thabs ji ltar rtogs pa rnams med pa'i dmigs @132b bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the methods of conceptualization, as they are understood, do not exist in the form and so on that were explained above as having no other side.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dngos po yod par lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dngos po yod par lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no conceptualization that views form and so on as having an existent thing and apprehends it as a sign.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos de dag zhi ba dag la rtogs kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos de dag zhi ba dag la rtogs kyang /
translated: Subh≈´ti, although bodhisattva great beings understand those dharmas to be peaceful,

original: de ltar zhum par mi 'gyur zhing bdag gis chos de dag ni 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhum par mi 'gyur zhing bdag gis chos de dag ni 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya'o //
translated: In this way, without becoming discouraged, they think, I will fully awaken to these dharmas in this way.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: How will I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?üîΩ How will I explain these dharmas, which are so peaceful, so excellent, in this way?

original: chos de ltar zhi ba de ltar bzang ba de ltar bshad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni dka' ba byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos de ltar zhi ba de ltar bzang ba de ltar bshad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni dka' ba byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the performance of difficulty.

original: byang chub sems dpas don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing zhi ba rnam par rtog pa dang tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa de lta bu rtogs kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing zhi ba rnam par rtog pa dang tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa de lta bu rtogs kyang /
translated: The bodhisattvas realize that ultimately all dharmas are empty by nature, peaceful, and not the domain of conceptual thought or words.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar sems zhum zhing zhi ba phyogs gcig pa la mi gnas par thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar sems zhum zhing zhi ba phyogs gcig pa la mi gnas par thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Without remaining in the one-sided peace of a shravaka or pratyekabuddha's depressed mind, they complete the accumulations of merit and wisdom in the relative, by means of skillful means, in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos zab mo zhi ba rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa bzang po de lta bu 'jig rten gyi sgra dang / tha snyad du sgro 'dogs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos zab mo zhi ba rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa bzang po de lta bu 'jig rten gyi sgra dang / tha snyad du sgro 'dogs te /
translated: And having fully awakened to unsurpassable, perfect buddhahood, they explain to sentient beings that excellent, profound, peaceful Dharma, which is beyond the domain of thought, by means of worldly sounds and conventions.

original: sems can rnams la bshad par sems pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi nus pa'i phyir dka' ba spyod pa ste ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bshad par sems pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi nus pa'i phyir dka' ba spyod pa ste ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the practice of the difficult, and it is amazing, because it is not possible for shravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi gling du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi gling du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, after a Bodhisattva-mahasattva has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he becomes an island to the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi gling du ji ltar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi gling du ji ltar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: In this way, the sutra explains how a Bodhisattva becomes an island to the world.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na chu klung ngam chu bran nas rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na chus yongs su bcad pa'i gnas gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni gling zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni gling du gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na chu klung ngam chu bran nas rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na chus yongs su bcad pa'i gnas gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni gling zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni gling du gyur pa'i dpes bstan pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this: in the great ocean, all the places that are completely surrounded by water are called islands.

original: dper na chu klung chen po'am /
analyzed: dper na chu klung chen po'am /
translated: For example, in a great river,

original: 'bab chu phra mo'am /
analyzed: 'bab chu phra mo'am /
translated: or in a small stream,

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na sems can gyi gnas su rung ba'i thang mtha' ma chus 'khor ba la gling zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na sems can gyi gnas su rung ba'i thang mtha' ma chus 'khor ba la gling zhes bya ste /
translated: or in the great ocean, the land that is surrounded by water and suitable as a dwelling place for sentient beings is called an island.

original: sems can @133a * //
analyzed: sems can @133a * //
translated: Sentient beingsüîΩare carried away by the water and have no power to remain. When they encounter such an island, they can rely on it and stay there. It is called an ‚Äúisland.‚Äù

original: chus khyer zhing gnas pa'i dbang med pa rnams gling de lta bu dang phrad na de la brten cing gnas su yod pa la gling zhes bya ba de bzhin du sems can yang dag pa'i don ma rtogs te /
analyzed: chus khyer zhing gnas pa'i dbang med pa rnams gling de lta bu dang phrad na de la brten cing gnas su yod pa la gling zhes bya ba de bzhin du sems can yang dag pa'i don ma rtogs te /
translated: In the same way, sentient beings have not realized the perfect meaning.üîΩThose who wander in the ocean of sa·πÉsƒÅra, when they find the place of nirvƒÅ·πáa, happiness, will not wander in sa·πÉsƒÅra. Like staying on an island, they will be placed in happiness.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho na 'khyams pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba rnyed na 'khor bar mi 'khyam zhing gling la gnas pa dang 'dra bar bde ba la 'jog pa'i chos zab mo zhi ba bzang po ston pa la gling du gyur pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho na 'khyams pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba rnyed na 'khor bar mi 'khyam zhing gling la gnas pa dang 'dra bar bde ba la 'jog pa'i chos zab mo zhi ba bzang po ston pa la gling du gyur pa zhes bya'o
translated: The profound Dharma of peace and goodness is taught. It is called ‚Äúan island.‚Äù

original: // rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in the same way, form is cut off from the prior limit and the later limit.

original: don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin yod par ma grub pas sngon yang 'di tsam nas byung ngo zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin yod par ma grub pas sngon yang 'di tsam nas byung ngo zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Since the nature of form is not established as existent in the ultimate, it is said, ‚ÄúIt did not come from before.‚Äù

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang 'di tsam nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang 'di tsam nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med de /
translated: The future is not something that will come into being from this point on.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis yongs su chad cing mtha' gnyis ka la mi gnas par mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par chos ston pa la gling du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis yongs su chad cing mtha' gnyis ka la mi gnas par mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par chos ston pa la gling du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the Dharma that teaches the Dharma-dhƒÅtu free from the two extremes, without abiding in either of the two extremes, is called an island, in the sense of not abiding in the two extremes.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it should be applied to feeling and so forth up to the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩSubh≈´ti, by this cutting off of the prior limit and the posterior limit, all phenomena are cut off.

original: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa 'dis chos thams cad yongs su chad pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i don gong du bshad pa nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste
analyzed: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa 'dis chos thams cad yongs su chad pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i don gong du bshad pa nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste
translated: This is a brief teaching on the meaning of the freedom from the two extremes of phenomena such as form, as explained above.

original: / mdor na chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas mtha' gnyis dang bral bar yongs su chad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: / mdor na chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas mtha' gnyis dang bral bar yongs su chad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief, all phenomena are also completely determined to be free from the two extremes, because ultimately they are not established as existent things.üîΩSubh≈´ti, the complete determination of all phenomena with respect to the prior limit and the later limit is peace, it is excellent.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o de ni bzang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o de ni bzang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes
translated: By this and so on, it is said that freedom from the two extremes is nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the synonyms of nirvƒÅ·πáa is as follows.

original: de ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su byang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su byang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is peace means that it is completely purified of all the obstructions to omniscience and the afflictive obstructions.

original: de ni bzang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pa'i gdon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bzang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pa'i gdon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is excellent means that it is free from all the demons such as MƒÅra.

original: de ni yang dag pa ste zhes bya ba ni don ma nor @133b cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ste zhes bya ba ni don ma nor @133b cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the real, because it is the meaning that is not mistaken and not distorted.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang / dmigs su med pa dang zhes bya ba theg pa chung ngu bas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dngos po yod par brtags pa lta bur dngos po yod par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang / dmigs su med pa dang zhes bya ba theg pa chung ngu bas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba dngos po yod par brtags pa lta bur dngos po yod par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is emptiness and non-apprehension, because it is not a thing that exists, as is imagined by those of the Lesser Vehicle, who imagine that nirvana is a thing that exists.

original: lam gyi rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i lam rgyun lngar mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i lam rgyun lngar mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cutting off of the continuum of the path, because one is not born in the five destinies of the continuum of the path of cyclic existence.

original: sred pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po phyi ma len pa'i sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po phyi ma len pa'i sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the exhaustion of craving, because there is no craving for the appropriation of future aggregates.

original: 'dre ba med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dre ba med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of contact, because it is not mixed with dharmas that are possessed of outflows.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la yang ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la yang ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is freedom from attachment, because it is not attached to things in the three realms.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gags te rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gags te rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cessation is so called because all karma and afflictions have ceased and their continuity has been interrupted.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana is so called because it is free from all the injuries of the aggregates.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,üîΩthe Bodhisattva, the great being, teaches the Dharma which is peaceful and sublime.

original: de ltar zhi ba de ltar bzang po'i chos de dag ston te zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba de ltar bzang po'i chos de dag ston te zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas /
translated: In this way, having realized all dharmas without error,
