original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnams sems can rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la 'god pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnams sems can rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la 'god pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva, by teaching the dharmas as they have been realized to sentient beings exactly as they are, becomes an island for sentient beings, establishing them in the blissful state of nirvana.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi snang bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi snang bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, how do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, become a light for the world?

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa dang mi shes pa'i rab rib sel te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi snang bar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa dang mi shes pa'i rab rib sel te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi snang bar gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here up to dispelling the darkness of ignorance and the cataracts of unknowing, it shows how they become a light for the world.

original: sems can rnams thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba'i mun nag na 'khor zhing ma rig pas bsgribs te yang dag pa'i lta ba la ma phyogs pa rnams /
analyzed: sems can rnams thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba'i mun nag na 'khor zhing ma rig pas bsgribs te yang dag pa'i lta ba la ma phyogs pa rnams /
translated: Sentient beings, from beginningless time, have been wandering in the darkness of cyclic existence, obscured by ignorance and not inclined towards the correct view.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'dzud pa ni 'jig rten gyi snang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan @134a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'dzud pa ni 'jig rten gyi snang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan @134a * //
translated: Bodhisattvas, through skillful means, lead them to the correct view, which is taught as becoming a light for the world.

original: pa'o // rab 'byor ji lta na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa'o // rab 'byor ji lta na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give to all beings the gift of Dharma, and they do so without taking anything as a basis.üîΩ And how do they give the gift of Dharma without taking anything as a basis?

original: sems can rnams kyang de la yang dag par bskul zhing sbyar la gzhog cing rab tu dgong de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang de la yang dag par bskul zhing sbyar la gzhog cing rab tu dgong de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give to all beings the gift of Dharma, and they do so without taking anything as a basis.üîΩ And how do they give the gift of Dharma without taking anything as a basis?üîΩ The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give to all beings the gift of Dharma, and they do so without taking anything as a basis.üîΩ And how do they give the gift of Dharma without taking anything as a basis?üîΩ The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give to all beings the gift of Dharma, and they do so without taking anything as a basis.üîΩ And how do they give the gift of Dharma without taking anything as a basis?üîΩ The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give to all beings the gift of Dharma, and they do so without taking anything as a basis.üîΩ And how do they give the gift of Dharma without taking anything as a basis?

original: sems can dam pa'i chos ma thos shing mi shes pa rnam la /
analyzed: sems can dam pa'i chos ma thos shing mi shes pa rnam la /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of giving, give

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi don ston pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa bsdu ba rnam bzhis sems can rnams sdud pa'i thabs ston pa dag sems can rnams la don ma nor bar ston cing /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi don ston pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa bsdu ba rnam bzhis sems can rnams sdud pa'i thabs ston pa dag sems can rnams la don ma nor bar ston cing /
translated: The MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras that teach the meaning of the six perfections, which are endowed with the blessings of the four noble truths, and that teach the method for gathering sentient beings through the four means of gathering, unerringly teach the meaning to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la spyod du 'jug pa ni sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la spyod du 'jug pa ni sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Engaging sentient beings in the practice of the six perfections, the four noble truths, and the four means of gathering is said to be ‚Äúholding the lamp and emitting light for sentient beings.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, become the guide for sentient beings?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir gcig la brten pa'i lam ston te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir gcig la brten pa'i lam ston te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúthe path based on one thing is taught for the sake of actualizing nirvana‚Äù teaches that bodhisattvas become the guides of sentient beings.

original: dper na tshong pa mang po lam ngan pa dang lam log par zhugs pa rnams ded dpon gyis skyong shing lam bde ba dang / lam la ma log par btsud de des na lam na nye zho med par gnas su phyin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na tshong pa mang po lam ngan pa dang lam log par zhugs pa rnams ded dpon gyis skyong shing lam bde ba dang / lam la ma log par btsud de des na lam na nye zho med par gnas su phyin par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as many merchants who have entered bad paths and wrong paths are protected by a guide and are led to the good path and the right path, so that they can reach their destination without any trouble on the way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can mu stegs can gyi lam ngan par zhugs pa dang / phyin ci log bzhi la zhen pa rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos bzang po bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can mu stegs can gyi lam ngan par zhugs pa dang / phyin ci log bzhi la zhen pa rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos bzang po bstan te /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattvas teach the good Dharma of the Great Vehicle to sentient beings who have entered the bad paths of the tƒ´rthikas and are attached to the four errors.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la btsud nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bzang po la 'god pa ded dpon dang 'dra ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa yin no @134b zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la btsud nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bzang po la 'god pa ded dpon dang 'dra ba'i phyir sems can rnams kyi ded dpon du gyur pa yin no @134b zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He is the leader of beings because he has set them on the noble path and established them in the good state of nirvana, like a caravan leader.

original: sems can lam ngan par zhugs la zhes bya ba'i ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba ngan pa la phyogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems can lam ngan par zhugs la zhes bya ba'i ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba ngan pa la phyogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase beings who have entered bad paths refers to those who are oriented toward the bad views of the heterodox.

original: tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log bzhi la zhen pa ste /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log bzhi la zhen pa ste /
translated: The phrase clinging to the four errors refers to clinging to the four inversions.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag yod par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'dzin pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa la tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag yod par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'dzin pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa la tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Clinging to the impermanent as permanent, clinging to the selfless as having a self, clinging to what is painful as pleasurable, and clinging to the impure as pure are called the four errors.

original: sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni sems can lam ngan par zhugs shing tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa rnams /
analyzed: sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni sems can lam ngan par zhugs shing tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhen pa rnams /
translated: The phrase for the sake of purifying beings refers to beings who have entered bad paths and cling to the four errors.

original: lam ngan pa dang tshul ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis mi gos par bya ba'i phyir lam ston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lam ngan pa dang tshul ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis mi gos par bya ba'i phyir lam ston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The path is taught in order to avoid the faults of bad paths and improper paths.

original: mya ngan dang gnod pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar par bya ba'i phyir lam ston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang gnod pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar par bya ba'i phyir lam ston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The path is taught in order to cross over sorrow and danger, and in order to set the sun of suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i chos go bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i don ston cing thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar spyod pa ston pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir lamüîΩston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i chos go bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i don ston cing thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel bar spyod pa ston pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir lamüîΩston to zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The path is taught in order to understand the Dharma that is endowed with reason, in order to understand the Mahayana sutras that teach the meaning of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and that teach the practice of the union of means and wisdom.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir gcig la brten pa'i lam ston te bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po gcig pu la gzhol ba'i chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir gcig la brten pa'i lam ston te bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po gcig pu la gzhol ba'i chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of manifesting nirvana, he teaches the path that is based on one, meaning that he teaches the Dharma that is directed toward the single Great Vehicle for the sake of attaining nirvana that does not abide in the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Subhuti, how does a bodhisattva-mahasattva, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren par gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren par gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: become a leader of sentient beings?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /üîΩsems can rnams gzugs @135a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste / sems can rnams gzugs @135a * //
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúhe teaches the Dharma because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is non-arisen, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified‚Äù teaches that bodhisattvas become the guides of sentient beings.

original: la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po yod par lta zhing /üîΩskye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po yod par lta zhing / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang /
translated: Sentient beings view all phenomena such as form and so on as having substantial existence.üîΩThey apprehend arising, ceasing, being contaminated, and being purified as having signs.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i chos zab mo bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i chos zab mo bstan te /
translated: To them the bodhisattvas teach the profound Dharma that all phenomena such as form and so on are ultimately empty of inherent nature and therefore are non-arisen, unceasing,üîΩuncontaminated, and unpurified.

original: sems can rnams don dam pa'i dbyings la 'dzud pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams don dam pa'i dbyings la 'dzud pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are the guides of sentient beings because they cause them to enter the ultimate expanse.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,üîΩbecome the path for sentient beings?

original: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams
translated: Up to: They teach sentient beings the Dharma, saying, 'The knowledge of all aspects has the nature of space.'

original: kyi lam du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kyi lam du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows how bodhisattvas become the path for sentient beings.

original: sems can dngos po la chags pa rnams la don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stod pas nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med de /
analyzed: sems can dngos po la chags pa rnams la don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stod pas nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med de /
translated: For sentient beings attached to things, ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature, like space, and do not exist.

original: cis kyang ma gos pa yin no zhes chos bstan na sems can rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lam ma gol bar zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cis kyang ma gos pa yin no zhes chos bstan na sems can rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lam ma gol bar zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: If he teaches the Dharma saying, ‚ÄúIt is not sullied by anything at all,‚Äù then sentient beings enter the unerring path to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, he teaches that he is the path for sentient beings.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of form is non-going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He teaches sentient beings the Dharma saying, ‚ÄúIt does not go or come.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /üîΩde ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste / de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects is non-going.üîΩHe teaches sentient beings the Dharma saying, ‚ÄúIt does not go or come.‚ÄùüîΩThis also teaches that he is the path for sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa la /
translated: Thus, he teaches that he is the path for sentient beings.

original: de ltar lam yod na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang yod dam snyam du rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas stong pa la ni lam yang med 'gro ba dang 'ong ba gang yang med do @135b zhes
analyzed: de ltar lam yod na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang yod dam snyam du rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas stong pa la ni lam yang med 'gro ba dang 'ong ba gang yang med do @135b zhes
translated: in emptiness, which is the ultimate, all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature, so there is no path and no going or coming whatsoever.

original: chos ston pa la de nyid theg pa chen po'i lam ma nor bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa la de nyid theg pa chen po'i lam ma nor bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Because this teaching of the Dharma is the unmistaken teaching of the path of the Great Vehicle, it is said to be the path for sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩSubh≈´ti, all phenomena have the character of emptiness, and they do not pass beyond that character.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa bshad pa'i don gang du smos pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa bshad pa'i don gang du smos pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste
translated: This and so on teaches the reason that was mentioned for the explanation that all phenomena are without going and coming.

original: / chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: All phenomena have the character of emptiness.

original: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhuti, why is that?üîΩUp to ‚Äúin the absence of wishes, coming or going is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: smon pa med pa la 'gro ba 'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin dang tha mi dad de /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la 'gro ba 'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin dang tha mi dad de /
translated: The nature of all phenomena is not different from the three doors of liberation.

original: rna par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
analyzed: rna par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de /
translated: Just as in the three doors of liberation there is no coming or going, likewise in all phenomena there is no coming or going.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i don ston pa byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi don du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gong du smos pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i don ston pa byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi don du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gong du smos pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who teaches the meaning of reality is of benefit to sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas //
translated: ‚ÄúSubhuti, all phenomena are of the nature of non-conditioning.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sprul pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sprul pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to ‚Äúin an emanation, coming or going is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are ultimately not established as existent things,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med de /
translated: they are not produced, not arisen, not ceased, not defiled, and not purified.

original: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since they are like a dream, an illusion, an echo, an optical illusion, a reflection, a mirage, the moon in water, and a magical creation, they do not come or go.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad mtha' yas kun du mtha' yas pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad mtha' yas kun du mtha' yas pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the character of being infinite and completely infinite.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /üîΩdngos po med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste / dngos po med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha'am /
translated: Since all phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature,üîΩthey are not things, and therefore they transcend the extremes of arising and ceasing,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: eternalism and nihilism, and so on. Therefore, coming and going are not observed.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbyung ba dang mi dbyung ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbyung ba dang mi dbyung ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are such that they cannot be brought out or not brought out‚Äù is stated becauseüîΩall phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature, and so do not exist as existent.

original: @136a * // chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas med pa la yod par sgo ma btags pa'i phyir sgro ma btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @136a * // chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas med pa la yod par sgo ma btags pa'i phyir sgro ma btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no superimposition of existence,

original: sgo btags pa'i dngos po dbyung du yang med la yod pa la yang med par skur pa ma btab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgo btags pa'i dngos po dbyung du yang med la yod pa la yang med par skur pa ma btab pa'i phyir /
translated: there is no entity of superimposition that can be brought out, and since there is no existence that can be denied as nonexistent,

original: mi dbyung ba yang med pa'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: mi dbyung ba yang med pa'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: there is no denial that can be brought out.

original: de lta bu la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus it is taught that going and coming are not observed in such a state.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin pas /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are such that they cannot be increased or decreased‚Äù is stated because ultimately all phenomena are completely pure by nature,üîΩand so there is no afflictive factor to be removed,

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dbrir yang med la ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dbrir yang med la ;
translated: and

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyis bsnan du yang med pa'i rang bzhin can la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyis bsnan du yang med pa'i rang bzhin can la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that there is no coming or going in the nature that is not even augmented by the side of purification.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are by nature such that they do not come‚Äù means

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag ste /
translated: that all phenomena are completely pure by nature.

original: mi 'gyur ba yin pas rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med de /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yin pas rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med de /
translated: Since they are unchanging, the phenomena of purification do not come from anywhere.

original: mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no coming or going in the unchanging perfect nature.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are by nature such that they are not to be adopted or rejected‚Äù means

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs blang du yang med la /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs blang du yang med la /
translated: that ultimately, since all phenomena are not established as existent things, the side of purification is not even to be adopted,

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang zhing dor du yang med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang zhing dor du yang med de /
translated: and the side of afflictions is not even to be abandoned or rejected.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa 'gro ba'am 'ong ba yang dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa 'gro ba'am 'ong ba yang dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the going or coming of a non-entity is also not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni phrad pa med pa dang / 'bral ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni phrad pa med pa dang / 'bral ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are of the nature of non-contact and non-separation.

original: don dam par chos thams cad thog na nas zhi zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin pas sngar 'dus byas kyi dngos po dang phrad ba yang med la /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad thog na nas zhi zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin pas sngar 'dus byas kyi dngos po dang phrad ba yang med la /
translated: This means that ultimately all phenomena are primordially peaceful and naturally completely pure. Therefore, they never previously came into contact with conditioned entities.

original: phyis 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin spangs shing 'bral bar 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: phyis 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin spangs shing 'bral bar 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: Later, they do not abandon and separate from the nature of conditioned phenomena,

original: rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because their nature does not change. The meaning is that going and coming are not apprehended.

original: rang 'byor chos thams cad ni 'dre ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang 'byor chos thams cad ni 'dre ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are of the nature of non-mixture.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres par 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres par 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: This means that ultimately all phenomena are naturally completely pure. Therefore, they never become mixed with the afflictions.

original: gnyen po @136b bsgoms na 'dres par mi 'gyur ba yang med de de ltar yongs su dag pa la 'gro ba 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po @136b bsgoms na 'dres par mi 'gyur ba yang med de de ltar yongs su dag pa la 'gro ba 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There is also nothing that does not become mixed if one cultivates the antidote. Thus, it is taught that going and coming are not observed in complete purity.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bdag gi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bdag gi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the nature of self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor mthong ba po nyid kyang shin tu med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor mthong ba po nyid kyang shin tu med na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, since the seer itself is utterly non-existent,üîΩhow could there be any going or coming in that?

original: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste /üîΩdngos po med pa la yod par sgro btags shing 'khrul pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste / dngos po med pa la yod par sgro btags shing 'khrul pa ni /
translated: This passage shows that ultimately all phenomena are not established as existent things.

original: dper na mu stegs can gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug ba po dang /
analyzed: dper na mu stegs can gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug ba po dang /
translated: The superimposition and confusion of non-existent things as existent is like, for example, the self imputed by tƒ´rthikas, the sentient being, the life-force, the being, the nourished being, the person, the individual, the one with exertion, the one with exertion-control, the agent, and the instigator.

original: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po rnams kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po rnams kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the one who begs, the one who gives, the one who feels, the one who causes feeling, the one who knows, and the one who sees do not exist even conventionally.

original: de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dngos po yod par ma grub pas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dngos po yod par ma grub pas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as they do not come or go, so also all phenomena are not established as existent entities, and therefore do not come or go.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rtag pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rtag pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the nature of permanence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sdug pa nyid kyang shin tu med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor sdug pa nyid kyang shin tu med na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, since beauty itself does not exist at all,

original: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong blta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong blta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: how could there be any coming or going in that?

original: mu stegs can gyis mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar brtags pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag yod par brtags pa dang / mi sdug ba la sdug par phyin ci log tu brtags pa rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yang dag par spyod par ma grub pas de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar brtags pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag yod par brtags pa dang / mi sdug ba la sdug par phyin ci log tu brtags pa rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yang dag par spyod par ma grub pas de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The non-Buddhists imagine the impermanent to be permanent, suffering to be happiness, the non-self to be a self, and the impure to be pure. Just as these are not really existent, so also all phenomena are not established as really existent. Therefore, there is no going or coming in them.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the mode of being impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor mi sdug pa nyid kyang shin tu med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor mi sdug pa nyid kyang shin tu med na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, since even repulsiveness is utterly non-existent,

original: de la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni theg pa chung ngu ba rnams kyis chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnag bzhin du brtags pa de @137a * //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni theg pa chung ngu ba rnams kyis chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnag bzhin du brtags pa de @137a * //
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown that even those things that are imputed by those of the Lesser Vehicle as impermanent, painful,

original: dag kyang don dam par de lta bu'i rang bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dag kyang don dam par de lta bu'i rang bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: without a self, and as having the nature of a corpse are not ultimately existent in that way.

original: de bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no coming or going.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, all phenomena have the nature of desire.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor lta ba'i rnam pa'i dngos po nyid kyang shin tu med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor lta ba'i rnam pa'i dngos po nyid kyang shin tu med na /
translated: Subhuti, since the very entities of the aspects of views do not exist at all,

original: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: how could there be any coming or going in that?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: hatred, delusion, the view of the transitory collection, the view of extremes, and so on are not real,

original: chos thams cad kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the nature of suchness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos gang la yang g-yo ba med de 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos gang la yang g-yo ba med de 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, no phenomenon moves, goes, or comes.

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba med pa bstan pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / nyam pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thusness, the expanse of reality, the perfect limit, the ultimate, the inconceivable expanse, and the immovable are

translated: included among the synonyms of the emptiness of the expanse of reality.üîΩSubh≈´ti, all phenomena have the mode of form, and so on up to

analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du de las gzhan pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas /
analyzed: de dag la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa de bzhin du de las gzhan pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas /
translated: Just as they do not come or go, in the same way, all other phenomena, compounded and uncompounded, and so forth, are similar in being essentially unreal.

original: de dag la yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they also do not come or go.

original: skabs 'dir phung po lnga smos pa'i 'og tu phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg @137b pa las byung ba'i tshor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
analyzed: skabs 'dir phung po lnga smos pa'i 'og tu phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg @137b pa las byung ba'i tshor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
translated: In this section, after mentioning the five aggregates, the twelve internal and external sense-spheres, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings that arise from the six contacts, and the six elements such as earth,

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnams ma smos pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnams ma smos pa ni /
translated: the twelve factors of dependent arising such as ignorance are not mentioned.

original: 'khor ba'i chos rnams phung po lnga'i nang du 'dus par dgongs nas ma smos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos rnams phung po lnga'i nang du 'dus par dgongs nas ma smos par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are not mentioned because it is intended that the phenomena of cyclic existence are included within the five aggregates.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zab pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zab pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Bhagavan said, Those who have been taken hold of by the spiritual guides will have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This passage from, Who will have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom? up to, Those who have been taken hold of by the spiritual guides will have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par dka' zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par dka' zhing /
translated: teaches that it is difficult to have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dkon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: that it is not the domain of all, and that bodhisattvas who practice this profound perfection of wisdom are rare.

original: sngon yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / sngon gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing mos nas spyod par 'gyur gyi gzhan la de lta bur dad cing spyod pa'i skal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: sngon yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / sngon gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing mos nas spyod par 'gyur gyi gzhan la de lta bur dad cing spyod pa'i skal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning is that they will have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom, those who have previously made aspirations for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and practiced the bodhisattva deeds, who have previously planted roots of virtue with the Blessed Buddhas, and who have been taken hold of by a Mahayana virtuous friend, but others do not have the good fortune to have faith in and practice like that.

original: to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-seventh chapter in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in a hundred thousand lines, called ‚ÄúThe Meaning of the Chapter.‚Äù

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: The request:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who will have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom‚Äù and so on.

original: gang du chos thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'i don zab mo bshad pa la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang du chos thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'i don zab mo bshad pa la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa yin la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who are interested in the profound meaning, where all phenomena do not go or come, have previously practiced the bodhisattva deeds.

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs bzung ba yin na /
translated: If they have served the victors of the past, generated roots of virtue, and been taken up by spiritual friends,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa ji lta bu zhig tu rig @138a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa ji lta bu zhig tu rig @138a * //
translated: what kind of nature, what kind of way, what kind of signs, and what kind of aspects should those bodhisattvas be known to have?

original: par bgyi zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: par bgyi zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is what Subh≈´ti asked.

original: bco / ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bco / ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par gyur pa de dag ni 'dod chags rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par gyur pa de dag ni 'dod chags rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThose bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who have become interested in this profound perfection of wisdom will have a nature that is isolated by the removal of attachment.‚Äù

original: chos tham can rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pas chags par bya ba dang / chags par byed pa gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: chos tham can rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pas chags par bya ba dang / chags par byed pa gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: By realizing that all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, they are free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags bsal te med par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags bsal te med par gyur pas /
translated: and since there is no object of attachment and no one who is attached,

original: 'dod chags kyi dri mas ma gos shing /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dri mas ma gos shing /
translated: they are free from the stain of attachment.

original: dben par gyur ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dben par gyur ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of those bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: are free from anger and ignorance, and so their nature is free.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are ultimately empty of inherent nature,üîΩby not observing any object of anger or ignorance, or any one who is angry or ignorant,

original: zhe sdang bar bya ba dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang / zhe sdang bar byed pa dang / gti mug par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhe sdang bar bya ba dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang / zhe sdang bar byed pa dang / gti mug par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: they are free from the stain of anger and ignorance.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dri mas mgos shing /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dri mas mgos shing /
translated: The nature of those bodhisattvas is to be free from desire, hatred, and ignorance, because they have eliminated desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: dben par gyur ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags kyi tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dben par gyur ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags kyi tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that the nature of those bodhisattvas is to be free from desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThose bodhisattva great beings are of the nature of being free from desire.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /üîΩzhe sdang dang / gti mug gi tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings are of the nature of being free from hatred.üîΩThose bodhisattva great beings are of the nature of being free from ignorance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi tshul ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi tshul ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the way of those bodhisattvas.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsal te /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsal te /
translated: As explained above, desire, hatred, and ignorance are eliminated by way of non-apprehension.

original: de dag las dpen par gyur na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyis g-yengs shing /
analyzed: de dag las dpen par gyur na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyis g-yengs shing /
translated: When they are free from those, they are not disturbed by desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: de dag la spyod pa'i tshul med de /
analyzed: de dag la spyod pa'i tshul med de /
translated: They do not have the way of conduct of those.

original: tshul de dag dang bral zhing /
analyzed: tshul de dag dang bral zhing /
translated: They are free from those ways,üîΩand are isolated from those ways.

original: tshul de dag las dben par gyur pa nyi byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi tshul dang / rtags yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul de dag las dben par gyur pa nyi byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi tshul dang / rtags yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Those are the way and the signs of those bodhisattvas.

original: @138b rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: @138b rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings

original: 'dod chags kyi mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: will have a nature that is isolated from the signs of attachment.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings will have a nature that is isolated from the signs of aversion and delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan ma bstan pa ste /üîΩ'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan ma bstan pa ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This shows the signs of those bodhisattvas.üîΩThe signs of attachment, aversion, and delusion

original: skabs 'dir 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu dang / dmigs pa'i yul la bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu dang / dmigs pa'i yul la bya ste /
translated: in this context refer to the causes of attachment, aversion, and delusion, and to the objects that are their focal objects.

original: de la rgyu ni bag chags dang / bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni bag chags dang / bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The cause is the non-abandonment of latent impressions and proclivities, and the improper mental attention.üîΩThe objective reference is the object of desire, such as a beautiful woman, the object of hatred, such as an enemy, and the object of delusion, such as the theory of self, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i yul ni bud med bzang mo la sogs pa 'dod chags ldang ba'i yul dang / dgra la sogs pa zhe sdang ldang ba'i yul dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dka' ba shes par mi nus pa'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul ni bud med bzang mo la sogs pa 'dod chags ldang ba'i yul dang / dgra la sogs pa zhe sdang ldang ba'i yul dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dka' ba shes par mi nus pa'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams la bya ste /
translated: The sign is the appearance of the object in the form of the sign of desire, etc.

original: mtshan ma de dag byang chub sems dpa' la med cing dben par gyur pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag byang chub sems dpa' la med cing dben par gyur pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The absence of those signs in the Bodhisattva is the very sign of the Bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags kyi rnam pas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags kyi rnam pas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas will become the nature of seclusion from the aspect of desire.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rnam pas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rnam pas dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas will become of the nature of being isolated from the aspects of hatred and delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rnam pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi rnam pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows what kind of aspects those Bodhisattvas have.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called aspects of attachment, hatred, and delusion are

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yul la 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'am rtags la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yul la 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'am rtags la bya ste /
translated: the signs or marks of engaging in the objects of attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rnam pa bsal bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i mngon rtags med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rnam pa bsal bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i mngon rtags med de /
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas have eliminated the aspects of attachment, hatred, and delusion, there are no manifest signs of engaging in the objects of attachment and so forth.

original: dben par gyur pa nyid de'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dben par gyur pa nyid de'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That very isolation is their aspect.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yongs su btsal bar gyur pa de dag @139a * //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yongs su btsal bar gyur pa de dag @139a * //
translated: He said, Blessed One, what is the nature of those bodhisattva great beings who have thoroughly investigated this profound perfection of wisdom?üîΩ This is asking about the nature of those bodhisattvas who possess the nature, disposition, signs, and aspects explained above, and who have realized the meaning of the profound perfection of wisdom.

original: gi ngang tshul ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'i rang bzhin dang / ngang tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i don rtogs pa de dag ci la brten pa'i rang bzhin nam ;üîΩngang tshul lags zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa la /
analyzed: gi ngang tshul ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'i rang bzhin dang / ngang tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i don rtogs pa de dag ci la brten pa'i rang bzhin nam ; ngang tshul lags zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa la /
translated: What is their nature or disposition?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su shes par 'gyur ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su shes par 'gyur ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who will understand this profound perfection of wisdom will have the nature of omniscience.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has realized the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom

original: kun rdzob tu yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i don la rton la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i don la rton la /
translated: has recourse to the meaning of attaining omniscience even conventionally,

original: don dam par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin tha mi dad par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin tha mi dad par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and also in the ultimate sense, he becomes inseparable from the nature of omniscience. This is the meaning.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: He said, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva has the nature of omniscience.

original: sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin gcig ste
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin gcig ste
translated: Thus, those bodhisattvas who have realized the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom are ultimately of the same nature as omniscience,

original: tha mi dad na rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: tha mi dad na rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: and if they are not different, they have a nonconceptual nature.

original: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad dam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad dam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: So it is asked, do they perform the welfare of sentient beings?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can ni /
translated: Bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who have the character of omniscienceüîΩbecome a support for sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog kyang /
translated: Although ultimately they are nonconceptual,

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don mi mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don mi mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: conventionally, through skillful means, they do not fail to perform the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad cing rten du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad cing rten du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that they act for the welfare of sentient beings and become supports for them.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes go cha 'di 'tshal kyang /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes go cha 'di 'tshal kyang /
translated: The Lord: Those bodhisattva great beings who, although they have taken up this armor, thinking, ‚ÄúI will liberate all sentient beings,‚Äù

original: de la sems @139b can dang sems can du gdags par mi dmigs pa de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sems @139b can dang sems can du gdags par mi dmigs pa de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: do not apprehend a sentient being or the designation of a sentient being, they do what is difficult.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin gcig ste rnam par mi rtog la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag don dam par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin gcig ste rnam par mi rtog la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas are of the same nature as the knowledge of all aspects ultimately, and are nonconceptual.

original: sems can thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas sems can du gdags su med par rtogs kyang thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba'i yid dam bcas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas sems can du gdags su med par rtogs kyang thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya ba'i yid dam bcas te /
translated: And they realize that ultimately all sentient beings are not existent, and so cannot be designated as sentient beings. Nevertheless, through skill in means, they make the promise, ‚ÄúI will liberate all sentient beings,‚Äù and take up the armor.

original: brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa de lta bu'i thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pa'i spyod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa de lta bu'i thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pa'i spyod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: The conduct endowed with means and wisdom of those who have donned the great armor of diligence is not the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag gis mi nus pa'i bya ba byed pa ni dka' ba spyod pa lags so zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mi nus pa'i bya ba byed pa ni dka' ba spyod pa lags so zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: Performing actions that they are unable to do is the practice of austerities.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /üîΩrab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha 'di bgos pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha 'di bgos pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who have donned this armor, thinking 'I will lead all beings to complete nirvƒÅ·πáa,' they are the ones who perform the difficult practice.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig dang / don gong du smos pa de brtsan zhing 'khor rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig dang / don gong du smos pa de brtsan zhing 'khor rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: In order to confirm the words and meaning that Subh≈´ti spoke, and to inspire confidence in the assembly, it is said it is so.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel ba ma yin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, that armor of bodhisattva great beings is not connected with form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyang shin tu med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang shin tu med la /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because form is utterly nonexistent,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha yang med pas de'i phyir go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha yang med pas de'i phyir go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and the armor of bodhisattvas is also nonexistent. Therefore, that armor is not connected with form.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, that armor of bodhisattva great beings is not connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shin tu med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shin tu med la /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects is utterly nonexistent,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha yang med pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha yang med pas /
translated: and the armor of bodhisattvas is also nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir go cha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir go cha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Therefore, that armor is not connected with the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes yid dam bcas shing brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa yang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug @140a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes yid dam bcas shing brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa yang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug @140a * //
translated: Bodhisattvas, who have made the promise to take all sentient beings beyond suffering and who are clad in the great armor of diligence, also know that form and so on are not the same as omniscience.üîΩ

original: gi bar gyi chos rnams la dngos por ldan zhing mtshan mar bzung ste /üîΩgo cha bgos pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gi bar gyi chos rnams la dngos por ldan zhing mtshan mar bzung ste / go cha bgos pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas, who have made the promise ‚ÄúI will lead all sentient beings to nirvana‚Äù and who have donned the great armor of diligence, do not don that armor in relation to phenomena from form up to omniscience, taking them to be real things and apprehending them as having attributes.

original: don dam par chos de dag thams cad stong par rtogs nas /
analyzed: don dam par chos de dag thams cad stong par rtogs nas /
translated: Rather, they don that armor having realized that ultimately all those phenomena are empty.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas go cha de lta bu bgos pa'i phyir /üîΩchos de dag gang yang ma 'brel zhing /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas go cha de lta bu bgos pa'i phyir / chos de dag gang yang ma 'brel zhing /
translated: And they don that armor in the conventional by means of skillful means.üîΩThus, they do not relate to any phenomena at all, and they do not come under the sway of any phenomena. They make the promise ‚ÄúI will lead all sentient beings to nirvana‚Äù and don the great armor.

original: chos de dag gang gi dbang du ma gyur par sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar yid dam bcas shing go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gang gi dbang du ma gyur par sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar yid dam bcas shing go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gang dag gis sems can thams cad bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha bgos pa de dag gi go cha
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gang dag gis sems can thams cad bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha bgos pa de dag gi go cha
translated: Subh≈´ti, the armor of those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom, who have donned the armor with the thought, ‚ÄúI must lead all sentient beings to complete nirvƒÅ·πáa,‚Äù

original: ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is not connected with any dharma.

original: gong du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha de gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad re re dang 'brel pa ma yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: gong du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha de gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad re re dang 'brel pa ma yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having previously explained that the bodhisattva‚Äôs armor is not connected with each of the dharmas such as form,

original: mdor bsdus te bshad pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha de ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te bshad pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha de ni chos thams cad dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: in order to teach the armor of the bodhisattvas in brief for the sake of those beings who delight in brief explanations, it is taught in brief that the bodhisattva‚Äôs armor is not connected with any dharma.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha 'tshal ba des zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes go cha 'tshal ba des zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who don the armor with the thought, ‚ÄòI will liberate all sentient beings from cyclic existence,‚Äô

original: de ni gnas ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing /
analyzed: de ni gnas ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing /
translated: up to ‚ÄòThat is not possible.‚ÄôüîΩThis shows the benefit of not falling to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels of those bodhisattvas who practice this profound perfection of wisdom

original: thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pas sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha bgos pa de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pas sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha bgos pa de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and don the armor for the sake of all sentient beings with a combination of wisdom and method.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don rtogs na /

original: mi ltos brtag pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin nam ma yin brtag pa'i thabs bstan pa ste /
