original: pha rol gyis smras pa dang / pha rol gyis bstan pa la snying por mi lta 'am zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: pha rol gyis smras pa dang / pha rol gyis bstan pa la snying por mi lta 'am zhes bya bas ni /

analyzed: gzhan gyis bslur tshugs sam mi tshugs brtag pa'o //
translated: refers to the examination of whether or not he is deceived by others.üîΩThe phrase does he not go by the faith of others?

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di brtag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /

translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúJust as one is nonconceptual with regard to phenomena such as the three doors of liberation that are nonentities,

original: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ci gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la dngos po dang mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa lags sam zhesüîΩ@143b zhus pa'o //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ci gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la dngos po dang mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa lags sam zhes @143b zhus pa'o //
translated: in the same way, if one is nonconceptual with regard to the perfection of wisdom, then do phenomena such as form up to omniscience apprehend and conceptualize entities and signs?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn replied,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas do not conceptualize form,‚Äù and so on,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa de brtag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa de brtag pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúhe does not conceptualize the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù explains that since all phenomena such as form and so on are like space and so forth, they are not objects of conceptualization.

original: de dag gang la yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang la yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he does not conceptualize anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni sus kyang ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni sus kyang ma byas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects is not made by anyone,

original: rnam par ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de /
analyzed: rnam par ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de /
translated: it is not produced, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the reason why all phenomena such as form and so on are not objects of conceptualization because they are not real things.üîΩIt is because the knowledge of all aspects is not made by anyone.

original: sus kyang ma byas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med pas sus kyang med pa las /
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med pas sus kyang med pa las /
translated: This means that since the knowledge of all aspects is ultimately not a real thing, it is not made by anyone.

original: yod par byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod par byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not made to exist.

original: rnam par ma byas zhes bya ba ni yod pa las med par ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: rnam par ma byas zhes bya ba ni yod pa las med par ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: ‚ÄúNot made to be non-existent‚Äù means that it is not made to be non-existent from existence.üîΩIt does not come from anywhere.

original: gang du yang ma song /üîΩphyogs na yang mi gnas /
analyzed: gang du yang ma song / phyogs na yang mi gnas /
translated: It does not go anywhere.üîΩIt does not abide in a direction.

original: yul na yang mi gnas /
analyzed: yul na yang mi gnas /
translated: It does not abide in a place.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It does not abide anywhere.

original: de ltar dngos po med pas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, since it is not a thing, it is shown that it does not come or go or abide.

original: gang la grangs mi dmigs shing 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la grangs mi dmigs shing 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: That which is not observed as a number and is not observed to come or go

original: gang gis kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: cannot be awakened to by anyone.

original: de ltar dngos po med de bgrang du yang med /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med de bgrang du yang med /
translated: Thus, since it is not a thing, it is not observed as a number,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang med pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa gang gi rang bzhin du shes par byar mi rung la /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang med pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa gang gi rang bzhin du shes par byar mi rung la /
translated: and it does not come or go. It is not suitable to know it as the nature of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang gis kyang shes par bya mi nus so zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang gis kyang shes par bya mi nus so zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that it cannot be known by anything, such as form.

original: de bas na don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to clarify that point,

original: gzugs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyis ma yin no //
translated: it is not by form.

original: tshor bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is not by feeling, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos gang gi rang bzhin du yang shes par byar mi rung la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos gang gi rang bzhin du yang shes par byar mi rung la /
translated: It is not suitable to be known as the nature of any phenomenon, from form up to omniscience.

original: chos de dag gang gis kyang shes par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos de dag gang gis kyang shes par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cannot be known by any of those phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad @144a * //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad @144a * //
translated: Omniscience itself is form, and so on.

original: mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang gis kyang shes par bya mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang gis kyang shes par bya mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why it cannot be known by any phenomenon, such as form.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig pas /
translated: All phenomena are of one taste in the nature of omniscience.

original: bdag gis bdag shes par byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag gis bdag shes par byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable for the self to know the self.

original: dper na ral gri de nyid kyi sos ral gri de nyid bcad du mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na ral gri de nyid kyi sos ral gri de nyid bcad du mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: For example, it is not suitable for the edge of a sword to cut the edge of that very sword.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is because the suchness of form and the suchness of omniscience are a single suchness.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ro gcig cing /üîΩtha mi dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ro gcig cing / tha mi dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so on teaches the reason that all phenomena such as form are of one taste with omniscience and are not different.

original: don dam par gzugs dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig pas /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig pas /
translated: In the ultimate, both form and omniscience are the same in being the nature of suchness.

original: gcig gis gcig shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i yul ltar shes par byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i yul ltar shes par byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable for one to know the other, as in the case of an object of knowledge and a knower. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is with form,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so it is with the other dharmas up to the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This was the thirty-eighth chapter, ‚ÄúThe Perfection of Wisdom,‚Äù in the great sutra, The Perfection of Wisdom of the Mother of the Buddhas.

original: // / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams /
analyzed: // / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams /
translated: Then the sons of the gods who live in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm,

original: lha rdzas kyi tsandan gyi phye ma dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog autpala dang / pad mo dang / ku mu da dang / punda r'i ka mang po khyer te /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi tsandan gyi phye ma dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog autpala dang / pad mo dang / ku mu da dang / punda r'i ka mang po khyer te /
translated: carrying divine sandalwood powder, divine utpala flowers, lotuses, kumuta flowers, and pundarika flowers,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga na ba de logs su mngon par gtor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga na ba de logs su mngon par gtor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: scattered them over the Blessed One.

original: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin tha mi dad de /
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rang bzhin tha mi dad de /
translated: In this chapter, the Blessed One explains that all dharmas, such as form, are not different in nature from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gcig tu bshad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bshad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the single reality is as follows: The reality of all phenomena such as form and so on and the reality of omniscience are one reality.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su med do zhes bshad pa'i don lha'i bu rnams kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su med do zhes bshad pa'i don lha'i bu rnams kyis rtogs nas /
translated: There is no duality, there is no nonduality.

original: de lta bu'i don zab mo bshad pas mgu ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don zab mo bshad pas mgu ste /
translated: Having understood the meaning of this explanation,üîΩthe sons of the gods were pleased

original: lha rdzas kyi mchod pa @144b rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod nas /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi mchod pa @144b rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod nas /
translated: and made offerings to the BhagavƒÅn with divine offerings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gong du bshad pa'i tshig de dag nyid bzlas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gong du bshad pa'i tshig de dag nyid bzlas te /
translated: Then the sons of the gods repeated the words that the BhagavƒÅn had previously explained.

original: gsol nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab mo blta bka' bas mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gsol nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab mo blta bka' bas mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: They said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, this perfection of wisdom is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, and should be known by the wise.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: It is difficult for all worlds to have faith in it.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab 'dis /üîΩ'di skad du gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab 'dis / 'di skad du gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is because of this perfection of wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas thatüîΩit is said, ‚ÄòForm itself is the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes so zhes bya ba nas /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes so zhes bya ba nas / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is form.‚ÄôüîΩAnd so on up to: ‚ÄòThe distinct attributes of a buddha are the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is the distinct attributes of a buddha.‚Äô

original: gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig par bshad pas lha'i bu rnams kyis bzlas te gsol nas de lta bu'i don zab mo ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab
analyzed: gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig par bshad pas lha'i bu rnams kyis bzlas te gsol nas de lta bu'i don zab mo ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab
translated: The gods repeated what the Blessed One had said above, that all phenomena are of one taste in the nature of the knowledge of all aspects, and then asked, ‚ÄúThis perfection of wisdom, which teaches such a profound meaning, is profound,

original: cing blta dka' ste /
analyzed: cing blta dka' ste /
translated: difficult to see, and difficult to understand.‚Äù

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is to be realized by the wise,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: but it is difficult for all worldly beings to have confidence in it.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of form and the suchness of omniscience

original: de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: are a single suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are nondual and indivisible.üîΩThe suchness of the buddhas and the suchness of omniscience

original: sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: are a single suchness.üîΩThey are nondual and indivisible.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes ston pa ni zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes ston pa ni zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This is taught up to

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: the divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.üîΩThis is to say,üîΩthe divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,

original: tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i tshig lha'i bu rnams kyis bzlas te gsol pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i tshig lha'i bu rnams kyis bzlas te gsol pa'o //
translated: and are not differentiated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,üîΩthe divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.üîΩThis is to say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' la @145a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' la @145a * //
translated: the divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.

original: khong du chud par dka' zhing /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' zhing /
translated: This is to say,üîΩthe divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.

original: brtag tu ma mchis la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma lags te /üîΩzhi zhing phra ba zhib mo mkhas shing rtogs pas rig par bgyi ba ste /
analyzed: brtag tu ma mchis la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma lags te / zhi zhing phra ba zhib mo mkhas shing rtogs pas rig par bgyi ba ste /
translated: This is to say,üîΩthe divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: This is to say,üîΩthe divine princes repeat the words of the Blessed One, who has said above that the suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in the nature of suchness,üîΩand are not differentiated.

original: de ltar chos thams cad don dam par de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bla na med pa'i byang chub yin te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad don dam par de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bla na med pa'i byang chub yin te /
translated: Thus, this perfection of wisdom, which teaches that all phenomena are of one taste in suchness ultimately, is the unsurpassed enlightenment of the Tathagatas.

original: zab cing blta dka' bas mkhas pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: zab cing blta dka' bas mkhas pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: Because it is profound and difficult to see, it is the domain of the wise.

original: sems can phal pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can phal pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: zab pa dang blta bka' ba dang / khong du chud par dka' ba dang / brtag tu med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang / phra ba dang / zhib pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: zab pa dang blta bka' ba dang / khong du chud par dka' ba dang / brtag tu med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang / phra ba dang / zhib pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words profound, difficult to see, difficult to comprehend, non-analytical, not the domain of sophistry, peaceful, subtle, and fine has already been explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to those sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm:

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin no //
translated: Sons of gods, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The divine princes, form itself is the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects itself is form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The distinct attributes of a buddha itself is the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects itself is the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par rang bzhin gcig pa'i 'chad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' la /
analyzed: gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par rang bzhin gcig pa'i 'chad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' la /
translated: The divine princes‚Äô statement above that this perfection of wisdom is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: unplumbable, not subject to reasoning or speculation, and knowable only to the wise,

original: 'jig rten thams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes gsol ba'i tshig dang don de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes gsol ba'i tshig dang don de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: and that it is not the domain of all world systems, was repeated by the Blessed One, who said, ‚ÄúThat is true.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The suchness of form and the suchness of omniscience are one suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /üîΩde @145b bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni / de @145b bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the buddhas and the suchness of omniscience are one suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang /
translated: They are not two and cannot be divided into two.üîΩThis passage teaches that the suchness of form and so on and the suchness of omniscience are one suchness.üîΩIt is the perfection of wisdom that teaches that the suchness of form and so on and the suchness of omniscience are one suchness,

original: gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa ste /
translated: that they are not different.

original: tha mi dad par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' ste /
translated: It is this perfection of wisdom that is profound, difficult to see, and difficult to understand.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is to be known by the wise,üîΩbut is not the domain of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes smras pa'i tshig dang don de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes smras pa'i tshig dang don de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlas te /
translated: The Blessed One repeated those words and their meaning,

original: de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: saying, ‚ÄúThat is true.‚Äù

original: lha'i bu dag don gyi dbang de gzigs pas /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag don gyi dbang de gzigs pas /
translated: ‚ÄúDivine sons, seeing the power of this meaning,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phrin las chung ba la thugs gzhol te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phrin las chung ba la thugs gzhol te /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is focused on having few activities,

original: chos bstan pa la gzhol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos bstan pa la gzhol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: not on teaching the Dharma.‚Äù

original: sngon de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: sngon de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: In the past, after the Thus-Gone One had attained full awakening,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar cang mi gsung bar bzhugs pa yang /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar cang mi gsung bar bzhugs pa yang /
translated: he remained silent without turning the wheel of Dharma,

original: don zab mo 'di lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: don zab mo 'di lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: thinking, ‚ÄúThis profound meaning is the domain of the Thus-Gone One alone,

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: not the domain of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: don de lta bu la dgongs nas /
analyzed: don de lta bu la dgongs nas /
translated: With this meaning in mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar bzhugs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar bzhugs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that the BhagavƒÅn should not turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos byang chub 'di ni zab cing blta dka' la khong du chud par dka' zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos byang chub 'di ni zab cing blta dka' la khong du chud par dka' zhing /
translated: This Dharma of the tathƒÅgatas, this enlightenment, is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand,

original: brtag tu med la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag tu med la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: inaccessible to reasoning, incomprehensible to thought,

original: zhi zhing phra ba zhi mo mkhas shing rtogs pas rig par bya ba 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba ste /üîΩde ni sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: zhi zhing phra ba zhi mo mkhas shing rtogs pas rig par bya ba 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba ste / de ni sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: peaceful, subtle, to be experienced by the wise and the noble ones, difficult for the world to trust.üîΩNo one has ever fully awakened to it,

original: nam yang mngon par sangs rgyas ma rgyas /
analyzed: nam yang mngon par sangs rgyas ma rgyas /
translated: nor will anyone ever fully awaken to it,

original: gang du yang mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: gang du yang mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: nor is anyone fully awakening to it.

original: gang la gnyis su kun nas rgyu ba med pa de ni chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang la gnyis su kun nas rgyu ba med pa de ni chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Where there is no movement of duality, that is the profundity of phenomena.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, when you first fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar bzhugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor bar bzhugs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The reason for not turning the wheel of the Dharma is taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa byang chub pa'i chos de zab cing blta dka' bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa byang chub pa'i chos de zab cing blta dka' bas /
translated: The Dharma of the Tathagata's unsurpassed enlightenment is profound and difficult to see,

original: sus kyang mngon par rtogs par bya mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sus kyang mngon par rtogs par bya mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because no one is able to realize it.

original: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur te /üîΩbrgya byin la sogs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar @146a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur te / brgya byin la sogs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar @146a * //
translated: The Bhagavat remained silent.

original: bskul dgos par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bskul dgos par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that he needed to be urged by Indra and so forth to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: zab cing blta dka' ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zab cing blta dka' ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words profound, difficult to see, and so forth is as explained above.

original: de ni sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: No one has realized it means

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub de don dam par dngos po med pas gang zag gang gis kyang ma rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub de don dam par dngos po med pas gang zag gang gis kyang ma rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that because that unsurpassed enlightenment is ultimately not a thing, it is not realized by any person at all.üîΩIt has never been realized means

original: nam yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that

original: de ltar dngos po med pa de sngon yang rtogs par ma gyur /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa de sngon yang rtogs par ma gyur /
translated: Thus, that non-entity was not realized in the past,

original: da ltar yang mi rtogs /
analyzed: da ltar yang mi rtogs /
translated: is not realized in the present,

original: phyis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and will not be realized in the future.

original: gang du yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not fully awakened anywhere.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa de khams gsum gyi gnas gang du yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa de khams gsum gyi gnas gang du yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that such a non-entity is not realized anywhere in the three realms.

original: gang la gnyis su kun nas rgyu ba med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la gnyis su kun nas rgyu ba med pa de ni /
translated: That which is devoid of the two is

original: chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the profundity of phenomena.

original: gang du bla na med pa'i byang chub de zab cing blta dka' bar bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: gang du bla na med pa'i byang chub de zab cing blta dka' bar bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste ;
translated: This clarifies the meaning of the statement that unsurpassed awakening is profound and difficult to see.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub de la rtogs par byed pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa med pa de nyid de'i zab mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub de la rtogs par byed pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa med pa de nyid de'i zab mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that the very absence of conceptualization in that unsurpassed awakening, as an object of realization and a realizer, is its profundity.

original: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir /
translated: Divine sons, space is profound

original: chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThis doctrine is profound‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin de zab pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin de zab pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the reasons and examples for the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThis doctrine is profound because space is profound‚Äù

original: lha'i bu dag mngon par 'du bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa zab pa'i phyir /üîΩchos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mngon par 'du bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa zab pa'i phyir / chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to ‚Äúdivine princes, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the absence of formation and the absence of complete buddhahood.‚ÄùüîΩThe passage from ‚Äúdivine princes, uncompounded phenomena such as space‚Äù

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dngos po med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dngos po med de /
translated: up to ‚Äúare not entities‚Äù

original: sus kyang mngon sum du rtogs par bya mi nus shing zab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sus kyang mngon sum du rtogs par bya mi nus shing zab pa de bzhin du /
translated: teaches that uncompounded phenomena such as space are profound because they are not entities that can be realized by anyone.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, this doctrine of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of unsurpassed enlightenment, is profound.

original: lha'i bu dag bdag zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúdivine princes, this doctrine is profound because the self is profound‚ÄùüîΩup to ‚Äúdivine princes, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the absence of formation and the absence of complete buddhahood‚ÄùüîΩteaches the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of unsurpassed enlightenment, by way of the profundity of the absence of formation and the absence of complete buddhahood.

original: lha'i bu dag mthong ba po zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mthong ba po zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The sons of the gods, because the seer is profound, this dharma is profound.üîΩ

original: mu stegs can gyis phyin ci log tu brtags pa'i bdag rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis phyin ci log tu brtags pa'i bdag rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúDivine princes, this doctrine is profound because the seer is profound‚Äù up to ‚ÄúDivine princes, this doctrine is profound because the object of knowledge is profound‚Äù teaches that since the selves imagined by the tƒ´rthikas as truly existent are not real,

original: sus kyang mngon sum du byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: sus kyang mngon sum du byar mi rung ste /
translated: they cannot be directly perceived by anyone.

original: zab pa de bzhin du bla na med pa'i @146b byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩlha'i bu dag gzugs zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zab pa de bzhin du bla na med pa'i @146b byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bstan pa'o // lha'i bu dag gzugs zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Just as it is profound, this doctrine of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of unsurpassed enlightenment, is also profound.

original: lha'i bu dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúDivine princes, this doctrine is profound because form is profound‚Äù up to ‚ÄúDivine princes, this doctrine is profound because omniscience is profound‚Äù teaches that

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: all phenomena such as form are ultimately empty of inherent nature.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin 'di kho na'o zhes sus kyang thog tu mi phebs pas /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin 'di kho na'o zhes sus kyang thog tu mi phebs pas /
translated: Since no one can say, ‚ÄúThe nature of these phenomena is only this,‚Äù

original: zab pa de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zab pa de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as it is profound, so too this Dharma of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of unsurpassed enlightenment, is profound.

original: lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa /
translated: The divine princes said:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'i chos bstan pa 'di ni ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba'i chos bstan pa 'di ni ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, this teaching of the Dharma, which is difficult for the entire world to have faith in, is amazing.‚Äù

original: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pas lha'i bu rnams mgu nas /
analyzed: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pas lha'i bu rnams mgu nas /

analyzed: de lta bu'i chos zab mo bstan pa shin tu dkon te ngo mtshar che'o zhes bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'o //
translated: They praise the Blessed One, saying, ‚ÄúSuch a teaching of the profound Dharma is extremely rare and amazing.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i slad du ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i slad du ma lags /
translated: Blessed One, this is not for the sake of apprehending form,

original: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: nor is it taught for the sake of not apprehending it.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzung ba'i slad du ma lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzung ba'i slad du ma lags /
translated: It is not for the sake of apprehending the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúit is not taught in order to grasp‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' zhing zab pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' zhing zab pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /

analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so zhes dngos po dang mtshan mar gzung du yod par yang bstan la /

analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du yang med do zhes rnam pa thams cad du med par skur ba btab pa ste /

analyzed: med pa'i mtha' la chags par bya ba'i phyir yang ma bstan pas /

analyzed: chos 'di zab bo zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni bdag gi gzugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni bdag gi gzugs so //

original: bdag ni gzugs can no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs can no zhes bya ba nas /

original: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄòI am omniscience.‚Äô

original: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar 'dzin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar @147a * //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar 'dzin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar @147a * //

analyzed: gyis ni / 'jig rten thams cad chos zab mo la yid mi ches pa'i rgyu bstan pa ste /

analyzed: chos rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //

analyzed: de de bzhin te /

analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /

analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

analyzed: gang du lha'i bu rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pas bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: the gods‚Äô question is repeated: ‚ÄúIn order for the gods to understand that this perfection of wisdom is not taught for the purpose of superimposition or denial with regard to all phenomena such as form,

translated: it is taught as a reason for the profundity that is difficult for the whole world to believe, saying ‚ÄòIt is not taught for the purpose of apprehending all phenomena such as form,üîΩnor is it taught for the purpose of not apprehending them.‚Äô

analyzed: lha'i bu dag gang yang gzugs gzung ba'i phyir ram //

translated: If one does not realize the dharmatƒÅ of phenomena, one will not be able to cultivate the perfections and so on, the phenomena of purification, in a way that is completely pure of the three spheres.

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das chos 'di ni chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa ste zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral na gdod rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams bsgom nus so zhes bshad pa'i don rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas 'khor thams cad mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i chos zab mo la gzud pa'i phyir /
translated: Having understood this meaning, Subh≈´ti, in order to introduce the entire assembly to the profound Dharma free from the two extremes,

analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i chos zab mo 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad yongs su grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa'o zhes rab 'byor gyis smras pa'o //

original: chos 'di ni gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: chos 'di ni gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis te /
translated: This Dharma is unobstructed with regard to anything.

analyzed: ci la yang thogs pa ma mchis she na /

analyzed: gzugs la thogs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /

translated: ‚ÄúThis dharma is the same as space, the same as suchness,‚Äù and so on up to

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du /

analyzed: chos 'di ni gzugs kyi skye ba mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di yang gang na yang mi gnas /

analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the gods of the realm of sense desire and of the realm of form said to the Lord:

translated: This is the praise of Subh≈´ti by the gods, who were delighted by his explanation of this profound perfection of wisdom, which is in harmony with all purified phenomena,

analyzed: chos thams cad la thogs pa med par bshad pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dang mnyam pa nyid du bshad pa dang / skye ba med par bshad pa dang / rten med par bshad pas lha'i bu rnams mgu nas /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang chos mthun par ston pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang mthun par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor ni ci dang ci ston pa de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing ston to ;
translated: In this way, whatever the elder Subh≈´ti teaches, he teaches it all starting from emptiness.

analyzed: / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams shing ston to zhes bya bas ni /

translated: This shows the reason that Subh≈´ti is a follower of the BhagavƒÅn.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn teaches the profound Dharma of the three doors of liberation.

analyzed: rab 'byor yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi chos zab mo ston te /

analyzed: de ltar chos zab mo ston par rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su skyes so zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: he is a follower of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di @148b skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa dang rab 'byor gnyis don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad de rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di @148b skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / de bzhin gshegs pa dang rab 'byor gnyis don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad de rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm, ‚ÄúThus,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa yin par rab 'byor gyis bshad pa ste /

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti was born after the suchness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rab 'byor gnyis de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rab 'byor gnyis de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /

analyzed: tha mi dad cing rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du /

analyzed: thog ma nas gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya bas ni ;

analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su dag cing 'gyur ba med pas /

original: thog ma yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: thog ma yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /

original: tha ma gar yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: tha ma gar yang mi 'gro ste /

translated: Thus, the elder Subh≈´ti is born after the TathƒÅgata. This is a summary teaching of the meaning explained above, that ultimately the Blessed One and Subh≈´ti are of one taste in suchness,

analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma la phyin ci log tu rtogs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad pa dbyer med pa 'byed pa ma yin pa /

analyzed: dmigs su med pa ste zhes bya bas ni don dam par de bzhin nyid de dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin pas /

analyzed: dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya bas ni /

original: gong du bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This concludes the teaching by summarizing the meaning taught above.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the thusness of the TathƒÅgata is not separate from the thusness of all phenomena,

original: de nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: and it is never not thusness,üîΩit is always thusness.

original: rtag tu de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig la /
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig la /
translated: The dharmakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata, which has the nature of emptiness, is not separate from the emptiness of all phenomena, for they are the same in having the nature of emptiness.

original: de yang sngon yongs su ma dag pa las phyis yongs su dag par 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: de yang sngon yongs su ma dag pa las phyis yongs su dag par 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that it was previously impure and later becomes pure,

original: rtag tu yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: for it always has the nature of purity.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor yang rnam pa gzhan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor yang rnam pa gzhan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang /
translated: In the same way, the elder Subh≈´ti is not different, for he is born after the TathƒÅgata.

original: gar yang rjes su skyes pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gar yang rjes su skyes pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNowhere does it arise‚Äù means that the dharmakƒÅya of the TathƒÅgata is the nature of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig cing dus thams cad du yongs su su dag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig cing dus thams cad du yongs su su dag pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is of one taste with the emptiness of all phenomena and is completely pure at all times.

original: rab 'byor gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang dus thams cad du yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang dus thams cad du yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: In the same way, Subh≈´ti‚Äôs nature of emptiness is completely pure at all times.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, because it is in accord with the nature of the TathƒÅgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes kun rdzob tu btags kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes kun rdzob tu btags kyang /
translated: it is designated conventionally as ‚Äúarisen after the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni gang @150b du yang skyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: don dam par ni gang @150b du yang skyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'o // de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: But ultimately, it does not arise anywhere at all.üîΩThus, the elder Subh≈´ti is said to ‚Äúhave arisen after the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is said to have arisen after the TathƒÅgata‚Äù means

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa'i don gang du bshad pa rnams mjug bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa'i don gang du bshad pa rnams mjug bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarisen in suchness‚Äù is explained in the passage that follows.

original: kun rdzob tu chos zab mo ston par rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos zab mo ston par rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is in accord with the teaching of the profound Dharma on the conventional level,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa tsam du ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa tsam du ma zad kyi /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is not only that it is arisen in suchness,

original: don dam par yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad de /
analyzed: don dam par yang de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad de /
translated: but also that ultimately it is not different in its nature of suchness.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is in accord with that, it is taught that ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is arisen in suchness.‚Äù

original: 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis /
translated: The suchness of the past is the same as the suchness of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe suchness of the future is the same as the suchness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The suchness of the present is the same as the suchness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: In this way, the suchness of the past, future, and present and the suchness of the TathƒÅgata are nondual and indivisible.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing mnyam pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩgzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyis /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing mnyam pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyis /
translated: The suchness of the three times is the suchness of the TathƒÅgata, and the suchness of the TathƒÅgata is the suchness of all dharmas.üîΩThe suchness of form is the suchness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the TathƒÅgata is the suchness of form.

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the suchness of form and the suchness of the TathƒÅgata are not two and cannot be made two.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la /üîΩtha dad du dbyer med par mdor bstan pa'i don de nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la / tha dad du dbyer med par mdor bstan pa'i don de nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects and the suchness of the Tathagata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de bzhin nyid la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'o //
translated: This passage explains in detail the meaning of the above brief presentation that the suchness of the Tathagata, the suchness of Subhuti, and the suchness of all phenomena are not differentiated.

original: 'di ni rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: This, Subhuti, is the suchness of the Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: The bodhisattva mahasattva

original: de bzhin nyid de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: having fully awakened to that suchness

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur @151a * //üîΩba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur @151a * //üîΩba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: attains the name Tathagata.

original: chos kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid zab mo de lta bu khong du chud nas /
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid zab mo de lta bu khong du chud nas /
translated: Having understood such a profound suchness, the reality of phenomena,

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: the qualities of becoming a tathagata are taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yang gzhan la mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yang gzhan la mi bya'o //
translated: The term tathagata should not be taken to mean anything else.

original: gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de lta bu rtogs pa la bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de lta bu rtogs pa la bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it should be understood as the realization of such a nondual suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi le'u 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi le'u 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this chapter on suchness was explained,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: this trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: chos zab mo de lta bu bshad pas /
analyzed: chos zab mo de lta bu bshad pas /
translated: By explaining such a profound Dharma,

original: sa'i 'og na gnas pa'i lha mthu bo che rnams kyis kyang thos nas /
analyzed: sa'i 'og na gnas pa'i lha mthu bo che rnams kyis kyang thos nas /
translated: even the powerful gods dwelling beneath the earth heard it,

original: dga' zhing mgu ba'i shugs kyis lus bsgul zhing bskyod pa las /
analyzed: dga' zhing mgu ba'i shugs kyis lus bsgul zhing bskyod pa las /
translated: and through the force of their joy and delight, their bodies trembled and shook.

original: sa chen po g-yos pa'i 'gyur ba bstan pa yang rnam pa gcig tu na dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: sa chen po g-yos pa'i 'gyur ba bstan pa yang rnam pa gcig tu na dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi /
translated: The shaking of the great earth is an indication that the tathagatas of the three times

original: de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i don zab mo 'di lta bu bshad pa'i mthu dang byin gyis /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i don zab mo 'di lta bu bshad pa'i mthu dang byin gyis /
translated: The power and blessing of explaining this profound meaning of nondual suchness

original: snod kyi 'jig rten nyid rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur pa'i ngo mtshar dang / ya mtshan chen po lta bu mthong na /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten nyid rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur pa'i ngo mtshar dang / ya mtshan chen po lta bu mthong na /
translated: is like seeing a great wonder and marvel of the world of the vessel itself shaking in six ways.

original: sems can thams cad dad pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dad pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate faith in all sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: through the blessing of the BhagavƒÅn,

original: sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa bstan pa ste /
translated: this great earth is shown to shake in six ways.

original: g-yos pa'i rim pa dang / g-yos pa'i rgyus ni zhib tu gleng gzhi'i le'u las bshad zin to ;
analyzed: g-yos pa'i rim pa dang / g-yos pa'i rgyus ni zhib tu gleng gzhi'i le'u las bshad zin to ;
translated: The stages of shaking and the causes of shaking have already been explained in detail in the nidƒÅna chapter.

original: / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, the sons of the gods who enjoy desire and enjoy form, up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: they say, It is amazing to be born after the TathƒÅgata.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis ka'i tshul gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes par bstan pa'i chos zab mo lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas mgu ste mchod par byas shing bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis ka'i tshul gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes par bstan pa'i chos zab mo lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas mgu ste mchod par byas shing bstan pa'o //
translated: The gods were delighted to hear the teaching that demonstrated how the elder Subhuti was born in the wake of the Tathagata in the manner of both the relative and the ultimate, and they made offerings to him.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the elder Subhuti said to those gods...

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /üîΩgong du gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / gong du gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: ...the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is not born in the wake of anything else.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bshad pa la /
translated: Above, it was explained that the elder Subhuti was born in the wake of the Tathagata because he was in accord with the suchness of the Tathagata.

original: 'khor rnams kyi nang nas kha cig bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos @151b po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyi nang nas kha cig bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos @151b po yod par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to dispel the conception that some in the retinue have that there are things such as that which is to be generated and that which generates,üîΩ...

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar chos rnams dang / chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar chos rnams dang / chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med la /
translated: The phenomena from form up to omniscience, and the suchness of those phenomena, are ultimately not things.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: And the elder Subh≈´ti is also ultimately not a thing.

original: de dag gang gi rjes su skyes par yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang gi rjes su skyes par yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing that is born after them.

original: 'dus byas kyi rjes su ma skyes /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rjes su ma skyes /
translated: It is not born after the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba nas 'dus ma byas kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba nas 'dus ma byas kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and it is not born after anything other than the unconditioned, up to it is not born after anything other than the suchness of the unconditioned.

original: mdor bsdus te bshad na /
analyzed: mdor bsdus te bshad na /
translated: In brief,

original: don go bar 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: don go bar 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings who will understand the meaning,

original: gong du smos pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus nas /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus nas /
translated: all the phenomena mentioned above are summarized

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis su 'dus te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis su 'dus te /
translated: and included in the two: the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de dag kyang don dam par dngos po med pas de dag gang gi rjes su skyes pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par dngos po med pas de dag gang gi rjes su skyes pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Moreover, since they do not exist ultimately, there is nothing that is born after them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang rjes su skyes pa dang / zhes bya ba nas gang gi rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnas brtan rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi rjes su skyes pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang rjes su skyes pa dang / zhes bya ba nas gang gi rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnas brtan rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi rjes su skyes pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúIt is thus that the Elder Subh≈´ti is born after all dharmas‚Äù up to ‚Äúall those dharmas that are born after, and that will be born after, do not exist and are not apprehended‚Äù explains that the reason the Elder Subh≈´ti is not born after all dharmas is that

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus gsum char du yang skyed par byed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba'i chos gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus gsum char du yang skyed par byed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba'i chos gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: in the three times‚Äîpast, future, and present‚Äîno dharma that is a producer or that is produced exists or is apprehended.

original: gang rjes su skyes pa dang / gang gi rjes su skyes pa dang zhes bya bas ni 'das pa'i dus na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //üîΩgang rjes su skyed pa dang gang gi rjes su skyed pa dang zhes bya bas ni da ltar byung ba'i dus na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //üîΩgang rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'am /üîΩgang gi rjes su skye par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gang rjes su skyes pa dang / gang gi rjes su skyes pa dang zhes bya bas ni 'das pa'i dus na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o // gang rjes su skyed pa dang gang gi rjes su skyed pa dang zhes bya bas ni da ltar byung ba'i dus na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o // gang rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'am / gang gi rjes su skye par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni /
translated: By what is produced and what produces he shows that in the past, the phenomena to be produced and the producers are not and are not apprehended.üîΩBy what is being produced and what produces he shows that in the present, the phenomena to be produced and the producers are not and are not apprehended.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i chos rnams med cing mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: By what will be produced and what will produce he shows that in the future, the phenomena to be produced and the producers are not and are not apprehended.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /

translated: Then the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra said to the Lord: Lord, if the phenomena of form, feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the perfections, from giving to wisdom, are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the emptinesses are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the superknowledges are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the clairvoyances are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of the fruit of a stream-winner are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of a once-returner, a non-returner, a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha are not and are not apprehended, and the phenomena of a buddha are not and are not apprehended, then how can there be a distinction among the various phenomena of form, feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness, and so on up to the phenomena of a buddha?

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni zab pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

translated: ‚ÄúSuchness,‚Äù ‚Äúunmistaken suchness,‚Äù and so on should be known as synonyms for emptiness.

translated: The example of the bird without wings illustrates the danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis mi ldan pa bstan pa'o //üîΩsmas pa dang / snad pa'i sdug bsngal bar gyur pa bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa nas nyams te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis mi ldan pa bstan pa'o // smas pa dang / snad pa'i sdug bsngal bar gyur pa bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa nas nyams te /
translated: The teaching on the bird‚Äôs two wings illustrates the danger of lacking both wisdom and means.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar 'gyur ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar 'gyur ba'i dpe'o //
translated: The teaching on the suffering of being wounded and injured illustrates the danger of falling from the bodhisattva levels to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab tu mi ldan na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang mi ldan na dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la spyad cing bsgoms kyang /

translated: Even if they practice and cultivate the five uncontaminated aggregates of the thus-gone ones of the three times,

translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, if you ask why,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa rnams /

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis rnam pa thams @154b cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom pa 'di ni /

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
