original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

translated: The Blessed One, it is because from the time that bodhisattva great being first produced the thought of enlightenment up to dwelling in the knowledge of all aspects, they do not apprehend any phenomenon, from the knowledge of path aspects up to omniscience, or any phenomenon up to the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin na /

analyzed: shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i rgyu gang dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: Blessed One, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment of those sons of good family or daughters of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means should be known as doubtful.

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: the tshom ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab tu mi ldan par spyod pa rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar nges par lhung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the reason why bodhisattvas who practice without method and wisdom fall to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyi pa drug la 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par spyad na /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subh≈´ti, up to

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: that bodhisattva great being will emerge to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don 'khor rnams legs par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don 'khor rnams legs par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the retinue well believe the meaning explained by Subh≈´ti,

original: de bzhin nyid la bye brag dbyer med pa'i chos zab mo bshad pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la bye brag dbyer med pa'i chos zab mo bshad pa las /
translated: in the profound Dharma where there is no distinction in suchness,

original: the tshom med cing sems ma zhum pa /
analyzed: the tshom med cing sems ma zhum pa /
translated: without doubt, with an undaunted mind,üîΩwill emerge to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa legs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa legs te /
translated: What Subh≈´ti has explained is excellent,üîΩand he has great eloquence.

original: spobs pa che'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa che'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus the Lord praised Subh≈´ti.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po //
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being who has such qualities

original: byang chub gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: will emerge through what kind of awakening?

original: gong du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la bye brag med par bstan pa la yid ches shing sems zhum pa med pa /
analyzed: gong du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la bye brag med par bstan pa la yid ches shing sems zhum pa med pa /
translated: This is saying that in the above, the suchness of all phenomena is taught without distinction, and with confidence in that, without a depressed mind,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: it is explained that one will emerge in unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba gsum char yang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba gsum char yang /
translated: Those of the Hearer Vehicle, the Solitary Realizer Vehicle, and the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: so so'i byang chub la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces zer na /
analyzed: so so'i byang chub la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces zer na /
translated: all say that their own awakening is unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: byang chub 'di gsum gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'di gsum gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: So he asks, ‚ÄúThrough which of these three awakenings will one emerge?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out for full enlightenment, will come forth -

original: theg pa chung ngu gnyis byang chub kyis 'byung bar ni /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu gnyis byang chub kyis 'byung bar ni /
translated: from the two vehicles of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa yin te /üîΩ'byung ba ma yin pas /üîΩbla na med pa yang dag par @159a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa yin te / 'byung ba ma yin pas / bla na med pa yang dag par @159a * //
translated: but not from the supreme enlightenment.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩrab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: He will come forth from the supreme enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, should the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out for full enlightenment, stand in the supreme enlightenment?

original: de ltar chos zab mo bstan pa la the tshom med cing sems ma zhum pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: de ltar chos zab mo bstan pa la the tshom med cing sems ma zhum pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is free of doubt in the teaching of the profound doctrine and whose mind is not cowed will emerge to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang rab 'byor gnyis kas bshad pa'i skabs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid shes par 'dod pa'i 'khor rnams kyi don du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i thabs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang rab 'byor gnyis kas bshad pa'i skabs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid shes par 'dod pa'i 'khor rnams kyi don du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i thabs zhus pa'o //
translated: In the context of the teaching by the Lord and Subhuti, the assembly, desiring to know the defining characteristics of the means of accomplishing emergence to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, asked about the means of emergence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:üîΩYou should abide in the equality of the mind toward all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By this and so forth,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar gnas par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar gnas par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: he taught the means of abiding in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: thabs de yang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'o //üîΩde la sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: thabs de yang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'o // de la sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The method is taught as the perfection of thought and the perfection of application.

original: sems can thams cad la pha dang ma'i sems dang / phu nu'i dang sring mo'i sems dang / grogs po dang gnyen dang / rus gcig pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la pha dang ma'i sems dang / phu nu'i dang sring mo'i sems dang / grogs po dang gnyen dang / rus gcig pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Among them, ‚Äúone should abide in the equality of the thought of all sentient beings‚Äù up to ‚Äúone should observe all sentient beings with the thought of father and mother, brother and sister, friend and relative, and with the thought of one bone and flesh.‚Äù

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /üîΩsems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshig ste /
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste / sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshig ste /
translated: This teaches the perfection of thought.üîΩ‚ÄúOne should abide in the equality of the thought of all sentient beings‚Äù is a general statement.

original: dang po bsam pa'i gzhi nyid sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dang po bsam pa'i gzhi nyid sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pa'o //
translated: The very basis of thought is to establish the equality of the thought of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya ste mi mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni smon lam du btab cing yid dam du bca' ba'i tshe /üîΩskye ba rnam pa bzhir gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya ste mi mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni smon lam du btab cing yid dam du bca' ba'i tshe / skye ba rnam pa bzhir gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la /
translated: One should arouse an attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings, and not arouse an attitude of difference.üîΩThis refers to the time of making aspirational prayers and taking a vow.

original: nye ring dang byams sdang med pa 'di dag thams cad bdag gis /
analyzed: nye ring dang byams sdang med pa 'di dag thams cad bdag gis /
translated: One should arouse the thought, ‚ÄúI will establish all sentient beings, who are included in the four types of birth,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dgod par bya'o zhes sems bskyed de brtson 'grus kyi go cha bgos pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dgod par bya'o zhes sems bskyed de brtson 'grus kyi go cha bgos pa la bya'o //
translated: in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, without partiality or prejudice.‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya ste /
translated: One should focus on all sentient beings with an attitude of sameness,üîΩand not focus on them with an attitude of difference.

original: mi mnyam pa'i @159b sems kyis dmigs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsgral bar bya ba'i sems can rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i @159b sems kyis dmigs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsgral bar bya ba'i sems can rnams mthong ste /
translated: This refers to the time after arousing the thought of enlightenment. One sees sentient beings who are to be liberated in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon sum du gyur ba'i tshe yang mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs shing /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur ba'i tshe yang mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs shing /
translated: And when they have become manifest, one should focus on them with an attitude of sameness.

original: goms par bsgom par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: goms par bsgom par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the cultivation of familiarity.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i tshig 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i tshig 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same attitude should be applied to the other phrases, such as ‚Äúone should arouse an attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings‚Äù and ‚Äúone should focus on all sentient beings with an attitude of sameness.‚Äù

original: bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ste /üîΩde la bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ste / de la bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúI should abandon taking of life‚Äù and so on teaches the perfection of application.üîΩHere, the phrase ‚ÄúI should abandon taking of life‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI should abandon covetousness‚Äù teaches the perfection of the ten virtues.

original: sems can gzhan gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang tshad med pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang tshad med pa bzhi dang /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúI should generate the four meditative states‚Äù and so on teaches the perfection of the four meditative states and the four formless meditative states.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la bdag kyang spyod cing /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la bdag kyang spyod cing /
translated: I myself will practice the teachings, from the concentrations and formless absorptions to the six perfections and so on up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas,

original: gzhan yang spyod du 'jug la /üîΩde dag spyad pa'i legs pa brjod cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyod du 'jug la / de dag spyad pa'i legs pa brjod cing /
translated: and I will encourage others to practice them too.üîΩI will speak in praise of practicing them

original: de dag la spyod pa'i mi rnams kyi yon tan brjod de /
analyzed: de dag la spyod pa'i mi rnams kyi yon tan brjod de /
translated: and will proclaim the qualities of those who practice them.

original: rjes su yi rang bar bya ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar bya ba'i sgo nas /
translated: I will rejoice in their practice.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on how to practice perfectly.üîΩAnd even as you practice in this way, you should do so in a way that is beyond reference, as explained in the following lines:

original: de ltar gnas pa yang kun rdzob tu de ltar gnas par byas la don dam par ni de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa yang kun rdzob tu de ltar gnas par byas la don dam par ni de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate, you should practice by being free of reference.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams lan gnyis su zlos pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams lan gnyis su zlos pa /
translated: The four concentrations, the four boundless states and the four formless absorptions are mentioned twice.

original: snga ma rnams ni theg pa chung ngu'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma rnams ni theg pa chung ngu'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The former are meditative attainments by way of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: phyi ma ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩbdag gis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang lugs ma yin par mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyi ma ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o // bdag gis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang lugs ma yin par mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The latter should be known as meditative attainments by way of the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can gzhan gang rang byang chub shes pa mngon du byed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel @160a * //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang rang byang chub shes pa mngon du byed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel @160a * //
translated: ‚ÄúI too should enter into meditative absorption on dependent origination in its forward and reverse progressions,‚Äù and so on up to ‚ÄúI should also praise others who realize the knowledge of the solitary realizers‚Äô enlightenment and rejoice in that.‚Äù

original: par 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi goms par bya ba dang de dag goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi thag pa'i 'bras bu rang byang chub thob par yang byas la /
analyzed: par 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi goms par bya ba dang de dag goms par byas pa'i 'bras bu nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi thag pa'i 'bras bu rang byang chub thob par yang byas la /
translated: the twelve links of dependent origination, the four noble truths, and the results of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, such as the fruit of entering the stream, which are the results of familiarizing with those.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas te /
translated: And having attained the result of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, Pratyekabuddha enlightenment,

original: zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las kyang mi 'da' bar /
analyzed: zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las kyang mi 'da' bar /
translated: one should not pass beyond sorrow into the one-sided peace of nirvana,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: but rather abide in the perfection of the Bodhisattva deeds.

original: bdag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And one should enter into the faultlessness of the Bodhisattvas.

original: sems can gang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byas te /
analyzed: sems can gang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byas te /
translated: One should praise those who uphold the holy Dharma and rejoice in their virtue.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in that way, bodhisattva great beings who want to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: should stand in that with a method of not apprehending anything.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas nas kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas nas kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa dang /
translated: Up to here, with ‚ÄúYou should stand in the first bodhisattva stage, and having stood in the bodhisattva stages, you should bring beings to maturity, you should purify a buddhafield, you should generate the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba dang / tshe phun sum tshogs par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba rnams la /
analyzed: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba dang / tshe phun sum tshogs par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba rnams la /
translated: you should abandon all afflictions that are connected with latencies, you should make your life span perfect, and you should make the holy Dharma remain,‚Äù

original: bdag kyang spyod la gzhan yang spyod du 'jug /
analyzed: bdag kyang spyod la gzhan yang spyod du 'jug /
translated: you should practice yourself and you should also engage others in practicing them.

original: gzhan de dag la spyod pa'i legs pa brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gzhan de dag la spyod pa'i legs pa brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The other is to speak of the good qualities of those who practice them and to rejoice in them.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the perfection of application.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: de ltar gong du byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa de yang /
analyzed: de ltar gong du byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa de yang /
translated: Thus, the perfection of application of the bodhisattva is taught above.

original: kun rdzob tu ni dge ba bcu la sogs pa dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba la thug gi bar gyis sbyor ba rnams la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dge ba bcu la sogs pa dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba la thug gi bar gyis sbyor ba rnams la /
translated: In terms of the conventional, it is the application in the ten virtues and so forth up to the practice of the sacred Dharma.

original: bdag kyang spyod gzhan yang spyod du 'jug /
analyzed: bdag kyang spyod gzhan yang spyod du 'jug /
translated: One should practice it oneself and also encourage others to practice it.

original: de la spyad pa'i legs pa yang brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byas la /
analyzed: de la spyad pa'i legs pa yang brjod cing rjes su yi rang bar byas la /
translated: One should speak of the good qualities of practicing it and rejoice in it.

original: don dam par ni de la yang rnam par mi rtog mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: don dam par ni de la yang rnam par mi rtog mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, one should also abide in it by way of nonconceptuality and nonobservation.

original: shes rab @160b dang thabs mkhas par ldan pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab @160b dang thabs mkhas par ldan pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: One should train in possessing wisdom and skillful means.

original: de de ltar slob cing de de ltar gnas pas /
analyzed: de de ltar slob cing de de ltar gnas pas /
translated: Thus, while training like that and abiding like that,üîΩhis form will be unobstructed.

original: de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa'i 'bras bu chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa'i 'bras bu chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth teaches that the result of abiding in the perfection of such practice is the unobstructedness with regard to all phenomena and the non-grasping at all phenomena.

original: de la de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therein, his form will be unobstructed and so forth up toüîΩthe holy Dharma will abide without obstruction.

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa sgrib pa med pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa sgrib pa med pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas na /
translated: This teaches that if one abides in the perfection of such practice,

original: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one will attain the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is because the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva did not previously appropriate form, and so on up to:üîΩdid not appropriate the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the reason for the absence of obscurations with regard to all phenomena such as form.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas /
translated: It means that because in previous lives he realized that all phenomena such as form are unreal,

original: dngos po dang mtshan mar ma bzung ba'i phyir chos de dag la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po dang mtshan mar ma bzung ba'i phyir chos de dag la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he did not appropriate them as real or as having signs, and therefore he has no obscurations with regard to those phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is because that which is the non-apprehension of form is not form,

original: gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: that which is the non-apprehension of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba de yang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba de yang /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúit is not the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù explains that the nonapprehension of all phenomena such as form is not a nonapprehension of something that exists.

original: dngos po zhig yod pa las yongs su ma bzung ba ma yin gyi don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: dngos po zhig yod pa las yongs su ma bzung ba ma yin gyi don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: It teaches that ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su ma gzung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su ma gzung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena such as form do not exist, they are not apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di bshad pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di bshad pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When this stage of the bodhisattvas was explained, two thousand bodhisattvas attained the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par gnas par bya ba'i chos bshad pa 'di phan yon chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par gnas par bya ba'i chos bshad pa 'di phan yon chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: This explanation of the Dharma of the stage of perfect attitude and the stage of perfect application is endowed with great benefits.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
translated: Two thousand bodhisattvas attained forbearance with respect to the fact that dharmas do not arise.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa phyir mi ldog pa'i @161a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa phyir mi ldog pa'i @161a * //
translated: They attained the eighth bodhisattva stage, the stage of irreversibility.

original: sa la gnas par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa la gnas par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu dgu pa'o /
translated: This was the thirty-ninth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the extensive explanation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: // / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Thus have I heard. The venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord.

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa med par bshad pa'i skabs nas glengs te /
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa med par bshad pa'i skabs nas glengs te /
translated: This is the continuation of the earlier explanation that bodhisattvas do not turn back.

original: de ltar don dam par phyir ldog pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par phyir ldog pa med na /
translated: If they do not turn back ultimately in that way,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus
translated: In order to open up the section on the detailed explanation of the characteristics of the irreversible bodhisattva, Subh≈´ti asks, What are the characteristics of the irreversible bodhisattva in terms of the conventional?

original: pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: and the Blessed One gives the detailed explanation of the characteristics of the irreversible one.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa ni gang lags /
translated: The Blessed One, what are the aspects of the irreversible bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva?

original: tshul ni gang lags /
analyzed: tshul ni gang lags /
translated: What are the modes?

original: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
translated: What are the signs?

original: ji ltar bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes bgyi bar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes bgyi bar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: How should we know that this bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva is irreversible?

original: rnam pa dang tshul dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dang tshul dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, aspects, modes, and signs are as follows:

original: spyod pa'i mtshan ma gang dag gis 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya bar mngon pa'i rtags kyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i mtshan ma gang dag gis 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya bar mngon pa'i rtags kyi rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the signs of conduct by which one should know the categories of the marks of the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor 'di la so so'i skye bo'i sa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar bshad pa de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid la 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la so so'i skye bo'i sa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar bshad pa de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid la 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in this regard, all the stages that have been explained, namely, the stage of the ordinary person, the stage of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, the stage of the pratyekabuddha, the stage of the bodhisattva, and the stage of the tathƒÅgata, are all the same in suchness, without change,üîΩwithout conceptualization, nondual, and indivisible.

original: rnam par rtog pa med la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: This is the ultimate, where all phenomena are of one taste in the nature of suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mas bye brag tu dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mas bye brag tu dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it does not change from suchness, it cannot be differentiated by the aspects, modes, or characteristics called the stages of ordinary beings, ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathƒÅgatas.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug ste /
translated: It engages suchness just as it is.

original: de bzhin nyid las rnam par mi rtog cing //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las rnam par mi rtog cing //
translated: It does not conceptualize suchness.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog par 'jug ste /
translated: It engages in that way without conceptualization.

original: de ltar zhugs pa ni de bzhin @161b nyid de lta ba bzhin du thos nas de las 'das te /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa ni de bzhin @161b nyid de lta ba bzhin du thos nas de las 'das te /
translated: Having heard suchness in that way, one goes beyond it.

original: de dag de bzhin nyid la re re dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin par the tshom za ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin nyid la re re dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin par the tshom za ba gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no doubt whatsoever about suchness, whether it is singular, dual, or neither.

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa de yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa de yang /
translated: That irreversible bodhisattva

original: don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin du ro gcig par thos shing rtogs nas /üîΩde la bye brag med pa tha dad par rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin du ro gcig par thos shing rtogs nas / de la bye brag med pa tha dad par rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Having heard and realized that ultimately all phenomena are of one taste in that way,üîΩthey do not have any conceptual thoughts about them at all,

original: the tshom za ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: the tshom za ba gang yang med de /
translated: such as grasping at their specific characteristics or doubting them.

original: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: Thus, they do not grasp at their specific characteristicsüîΩand do not doubt them.

original: the tshom mi za ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught to be the aspect, manner, and sign of an irreversible bodhisattva.

original: de ni byung rgyal du smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni byung rgyal du smras pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not speak at random,

original: don dang ldan par smra'i /
analyzed: don dang ldan par smra'i /
translated: but speak meaningfully.

original: don dang mi ldan par smras pa ma yin /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par smras pa ma yin /
translated: They do not speak without meaning.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa dang / ma byas pa la mi lta zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa dang / ma byas pa la mi lta zhing /
translated: They do not look at whether others have done something or not,

original: legs par brjod pa tshol ba yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: legs par brjod pa tshol ba yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: but seek what is well-spoken.

original: tshig tu smra ba'i sgo nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par mngon pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba'i sgo nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par mngon pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mar bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught to be the aspect, manner, and sign of being an irreversible bodhisattva through the door of speaking words.

original: don med pa'i tshig cal col byung rgyal du mi smra zhing /
analyzed: don med pa'i tshig cal col byung rgyal du mi smra zhing /
translated: He does not speak meaningless words, nor does he speak in a rambling way.

original: mi gzhan la 'phyas 'dogs la /
analyzed: mi gzhan la 'phyas 'dogs la /
translated: He does not disparage others.

original: gzhan gyis legs par byas pa la phrag dog mi lta bar de'i yon tan brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis legs par byas pa la phrag dog mi lta bar de'i yon tan brjod na /
translated: He does not envy others‚Äô good qualities, but rather proclaims them.

original: rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: By these aspects, marks, and signs, one should know that a bodhisattva is irreversible.‚Äù

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti then asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, by what aspects, marks, and signs should one know that a bodhisattva great being is irreversible?‚Äù

original: don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa dang tshul dang mtshan ma med par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa dang tshul dang mtshan ma med par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This was asked by Subh≈´ti in order to open the section on the explanation that ultimately all phenomena are without aspects, marks, and signs.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are without aspects,üîΩwithout marks,üîΩand without signs.

original: tshul med pa mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma bstan pa yang kun rdzob tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: tshul med pa mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma bstan pa yang kun rdzob tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the aspect, the mode, and the sign is merely a conventional teaching.

original: don dam par ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, they are empty of intrinsic nature.üîΩSince they are insubstantial, they have no aspect, mode, or sign.

original: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa la rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma yang med de zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis tshul ma mchis /
analyzed: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa la rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma yang med de zhes bya ba'i don to // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis tshul ma mchis /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra then asks, ‚ÄúBlessed One, if all phenomena are without aspect, without mode, and without sign,

original: chos gang las slar ldog pa'i byang @162a * //
analyzed: chos gang las slar ldog pa'i byang @162a * //
translated: from which phenomenon do the bodhisattvas turn back?

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa bstan pa lags zhes bya ba ni /üîΩphyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba zlas 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa bstan pa lags zhes bya ba ni / phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba zlas 'grub pa yin te /
translated: What is the irreversible bodhisattva?‚ÄùüîΩThe term ‚Äúirreversible‚Äù is a compound.

original: phyir ldog pa zhig yod na de'i zlas phyir mi ldog pa zhes gdags su yang rung na /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa zhig yod na de'i zlas phyir mi ldog pa zhes gdags su yang rung na /
translated: If there were something to turn back, then it would be possible to designate it as ‚Äúirreversible.‚Äù

original: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are empty by nature.

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas med skabs med de /

original: de ni gnas ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to

analyzed: lam 'di nyid kyis nyan thos kyi 'bras bu bzhi thob par byas te /

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byos shig ces theg pa chung ngu'i lam ston cing /

translated: and they say to bodhisattvas who have served the buddha bhagavƒÅns as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, who have completed the six perfections for tathƒÅgatas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: and who, after serving the buddha bhagavƒÅns as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, have practiced the six perfections and so on up to omniscience,

analyzed: chos de dag la ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes zhus shing brtags kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúHow should we abide in those dharmas?‚Äù

original: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes snying smyan bcug kyang ;
analyzed: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes snying smyan bcug kyang ;

analyzed: sems nur bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bdud sdig to can gyis dge slong mang por sprul te /

analyzed: dge slong 'di dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa sha stag ste /

analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma grub nas /

analyzed: khyod ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub thob re skan zhes zer yang /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis spyod pa de ni / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yongs su mi nyams zhes bya ba nas sus bdud kyi las su rig pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag @166a * //
translated: That practice by those mental attentions endowed with the perfectionsüîΩis not a falling away from the perfection of generosity, and so on up toüîΩif one thinks that one who recognizes the activities of Mara will not fall away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nyid chos mi skye ba la bzod pa thob pa yin pas /üîΩphyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid chos mi skye ba la bzod pa thob pa yin pas /üîΩphyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Having thus spoken, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is how a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible from the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment has realized that all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics.

original: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This is called the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par lta ba'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par lta ba'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the reason why bodhisattvas turn away from the notion that all phenomena are things that exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pas /
translated: Because bodhisattvas realize that all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'i sa dang po la 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'i sa dang po la 'jug ste /
translated: they enter the first bodhisattva level, the level of the faultless.

original: sa dang po la zhugs nas /
analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered the first level,

original: don dam par chos thams cad rdul tsam yang dmigs su med par rtogs pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rdul tsam yang dmigs su med par rtogs pas /
translated: they realize that ultimately not even an atom of all phenomena can be observed.

original: ci la yang mngon par 'du mi byed de mngon par 'du mi byed pas /
analyzed: ci la yang mngon par 'du mi byed de mngon par 'du mi byed pas /
translated: Because of that realization, they do not engage in any activity.

original: chos gang yang skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gang yang skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not produce any dharma at all.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúacceptance of the nonproduction of dharmas.‚Äù

original: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
translated: Having thus gained acceptance of the nonproduction of dharmas,

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one should know that one is irreversible.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi @166b bcu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u bzhi @166b bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes Tenth Chapter, on ‚ÄúAcceptance,‚Äù in the Treatise on the PƒÅramitƒÅ of Wisdom called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can nye bar 'ongs te mos pa bzlog cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can nye bar 'ongs te mos pa bzlog cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, MƒÅra the evil one approaches a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva and tries to turn them away from their interest, up to ‚Ä¶

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /üîΩbdud sdig to can dag chos thams cad stong pa la tha snyad du btags nas de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / bdud sdig to can dag chos thams cad stong pa la tha snyad du btags nas de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la /
translated: they will enter into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'tshang rgyar yang ci yod ces /
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgyar yang ci yod ces /
translated: MƒÅra the evil one, having designated all dharmas as empty, says, ‚ÄúWhat is there to fully awaken to in all dharmas that are empty of inherent nature?‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' la mos pa dang dad pa bzlog cing 'ong ba la bdud kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i gdams pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la mos pa dang dad pa bzlog cing 'ong ba la bdud kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i gdams pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the instruction for turning away from devotion and faith in the bodhisattva and for not being harmed by Mara when coming.

original: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: Ultimately, all phenomena are equal to space,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong yang kun rdzob tu las legs nyes ci spyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa ma yin pas /üîΩbdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong yang kun rdzob tu las legs nyes ci spyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa ma yin pas / bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du /
translated: and although they are empty by nature, it is not the case that there is no result of whatever good or bad actions are done conventionally.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas la /
translated: Therefore, I will fully awaken to complete buddhahood in all ways.

original: sems can thams cad kyang rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dgod par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dgod par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed cing /
translated: I will gradually establish all sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdud kyis mi tshugs par sems brtan par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis mi tshugs par sems brtan par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: I will generate the mind and make my mind stable so that I am not harmed by Mara.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob cing /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob cing /
translated: Then, the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Blessed One... and so forth. This teaches that the bodhisattva has attained acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /

original: sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing sems can la gnod pa mi spyod na rtags dang mtshan ma de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing sems can la gnod pa mi spyod na rtags dang mtshan ma de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that those signs and marks should be known as the signs of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyi bzhin du zhes bya ba nas de ni skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyi bzhin du zhes bya ba nas de ni skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, furthermore, irreversible bodhisattvas, from ‚Äúgreat beings‚Äù up to ‚Äúnot bad people,‚Äù

original: skyes bu ngan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog @168b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
analyzed: skyes bu ngan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog @168b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
translated: this teaches the signs of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: gnod sbyin lag na rdo rjes rtag tu bsrung bas /
analyzed: gnod sbyin lag na rdo rjes rtag tu bsrung bas /
translated: Because the yaksha Vajrapani always protects them,

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par bya ba mi nus pa dang / lha dang bdud la sogs pas mi thub pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub yid la byed pa las mi ldog pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par bya ba mi nus pa dang / lha dang bdud la sogs pas mi thub pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub yid la byed pa las mi ldog pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: they cannot be harmed by humans or non-humans, etc., they cannot be overcome by gods or demons, etc., they do not turn back from keeping in mind unsurpassed enlightenment, and their faculties will not be incomplete.

original: skyes bu dam par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //üîΩgsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba nas skyes bu dam par 'gyur te skyes bu ngan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis skyes bu dam par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ji tsam gyis na
analyzed: skyes bu dam par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o // gsol pa bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba nas skyes bu dam par 'gyur te skyes bu ngan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis skyes bu dam par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ji tsam gyis na
translated: The benefits of becoming a holy beingüîΩSubhuti asks, Bhagavan, how is it that... and so on up to ...he becomes a holy being, not a bad person?üîΩThis is Subhuti's question about the extent to which one becomes a holy being, as explained above by the Bhagavan.

original: skyes bu dam par 'gyur ba tshad rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam par 'gyur ba tshad rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavan's answer is as follows.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma nyams na skyes bu dam par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma nyams na skyes bu dam par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one generates the unsurpassed Thought of Enlightenment and does not let it deteriorate, one becomes a holy being.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva

original: byang chub yid la bya ba dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba nas des mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub yid la bya ba dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba nas des mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
translated: is endowed with the thought of enlightenment, and so on, up to he does not see any sign,üîΩand thus his livelihood is pure.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi sngags dang sman dang ltas rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa dang / yid ches pa'i mtshan ma bstan pas rnyed pa dang bkur sti tshol ba ma yin zhing rgyu mi 'tsho ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten gyi sngags dang sman dang ltas rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa dang / yid ches pa'i mtshan ma bstan pas rnyed pa dang bkur sti tshol ba ma yin zhing rgyu mi 'tsho ste /
translated: By this he does not seek gain and honor through the magical spells, medicines, and omens of the world, and he does not live by a false way of life.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag na /
translated: If his livelihood is pure,

original: mtshan ma dang rtags de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rtags de dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that he should be known as an irreversible Bodhisattva by these signs and marks.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar phungüîΩpo dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la dngos po yod par lta zhing de dag las 'das par bya ba'i phyir brtson par mi byed kyi /üîΩphung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams stong pa nyid du sgom na /
