original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that one should know that he is an irreversible Bodhisattva.

original: de 'du 'dzi'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'du 'dzi la 'jig rten gyi gtam ngan pa rnams la mi 'jug pa bstan @169a * //
analyzed: de 'du 'dzi'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'du 'dzi la 'jig rten gyi gtam ngan pa rnams la mi 'jug pa bstan @169a * //
translated: This shows that the irreversible bodhisattva does not engage in the worldly talk and so on of socializing.

original: pa ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pa ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
translated: It is because the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvaüîΩhas thoroughly taken to mind the emptiness of beings.

original: sems can stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi'i spyod pa'i rgyu gnyen bgrod par byas pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams stong pa nyid du goms par byas pa'i phyir 'du 'dzi'i spyod pa la mi gnas so zhes
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi'i spyod pa'i rgyu gnyen bgrod par byas pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams stong pa nyid du goms par byas pa'i phyir 'du 'dzi'i spyod pa la mi gnas so zhes
translated: This shows that he does not dwell in the practice of socializing because he has accustomed himself to the emptiness of beings who are engaged in the practice of socializing, such as the practice of sexual intercourse.

original: bstan pa'o // de rgyal po'i gtam gyis sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // de rgyal po'i gtam gyis sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not dwell in the practice of socializing with kings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
translated: It is because he abides in the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: chos gang la yang bzang po'am /
analyzed: chos gang la yang bzang po'am /
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is good,

original: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la bstod pa dang / smad pa'i gtam ngan pa la ma zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la bstod pa dang / smad pa'i gtam ngan pa la ma zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not see good or bad‚Äù teaches that he does not engage in the gossip of praising or disparaging the king.

original: bstod pa dang smad pa'i chos bzang po dang ngan pa thams cad don dam par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstod pa dang smad pa'i chos bzang po dang ngan pa thams cad don dam par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately he does not see any good or bad phenomena that are praised or disparaged.

original: de rkun po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rkun po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not dwell in the pursuit of the gossip of thieves‚ÄùüîΩ.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: Because all phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: chos gang la yang blang ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang la yang blang ba'am /
translated: He does not see any phenomenon that is to be taken up orüîΩput down.

original: dbrog par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rkun pos rkur thob pa dang ma thob pa'i gtam ngan pa la yang g-yeng bar mi gnas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dbrog par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rkun pos rkur thob pa dang ma thob pa'i gtam ngan pa la yang g-yeng bar mi gnas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that he does not dwell in the distraction of the gossip of thieves, whether they have stolen something or not.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pas /
translated: The meaning is that ultimately he realizes that all phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: rkun pos dbrog par bya ba dang / ma phrogs te slar blang du yod pa'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong pas /
analyzed: rkun pos dbrog par bya ba dang / ma phrogs te slar blang du yod pa'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong pas /
translated: He does not see any dharma that is to be stolen by a thief, or that, having not been stolen, is to be taken back.

original: rkun po'i gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkun po'i gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not speak the talk of thieves.

original: de g-yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de g-yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not remain engaged in the talk of battle formations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
translated: Because he thus abides in the emptiness of inherent existence,üîΩhe does not see any dharma as either few or many.

original: chos gang yang nyung ngu'am mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni dmag gi g-yul bshams pa'i gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang yang nyung ngu'am mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni dmag gi g-yul bshams pa'i gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that he is not distracted by the talk of battle formations.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs pas /üîΩg-yul bshams pa'i tshogs 'di ni mang ngo //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs pas / g-yul bshams pa'i tshogs 'di ni mang ngo //
translated: Because he realizes that ultimately all phenomena are the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: 'di ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: he does not see any dharma that is either a large or small collection of battle formations.

original: g-yul gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yul gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not speak the talk of battle formations.

original: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not engage in the practice of talking about war.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas /
translated: Because he abides in the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos gang la yang byams pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang la yang byams pa'am /
translated: He does not see any phenomenon as being either loving orüîΩhostile.

original: @169b zhe sdang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni dgra zin gnyis dmag 'gyed pa'i gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @169b zhe sdang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni dgra zin gnyis dmag 'gyed pa'i gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage shows that he is not distracted by the talk of two armies fighting each other.

original: don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pas /
translated: Because he realizes that ultimately all phenomena are of one taste in suchness,

original: dgra zin dang byams sdang bye brag dbye med pa'i dmag gi gtam mi zer ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgra zin dang byams sdang bye brag dbye med pa'i dmag gi gtam mi zer ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: he does not engage in the talk of war that distinguishes friend from foe and love from hate.

original: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not engage in the practice of talking about towns.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
translated: Because he abides in the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: chos gang yang tshogs sam tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni grong gi gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang yang tshogs sam tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni grong gi gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not see any phenomenon as a collection or not a collection‚Äù shows that he is not distracted by talk of villages.

original: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas /üîΩgrong 'di ni tshogs che zhing stug go //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas / grong 'di ni tshogs che zhing stug go //
translated: Ultimately, since he realizes that all phenomena are emptiness,üîΩhe does not see any phenomenon as ‚Äúthis village has a large and dense population‚Äù

original: grong 'di ni tshogs chung zhing srab po zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir grong gi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grong 'di ni tshogs chung zhing srab po zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir grong gi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or ‚Äúthis village has a small and sparse population.‚Äù Therefore, he does not speak of villages.

original: grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not dwell in the pursuit of talk about cities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas /üîΩchos gang yang gzung ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas / chos gang yang gzung ba'am /
translated: Since he abides in the emptiness of space,üîΩhe does not see any phenomenon as something to be grasped

original: mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or not to be grasped.

original: grong khyer gyi gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that he is not distracted by talk of cities.

original: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du stong par rtogs pas /üîΩgrong khyer gyi tshong 'dus na tshong byed pa'i tshong rdzas khe yod na /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du stong par rtogs pas / grong khyer gyi tshong 'dus na tshong byed pa'i tshong rdzas khe yod na /
translated: Since they realize that ultimately all phenomena are empty like space,üîΩthey do not see any phenomenon at all that exists as an entity that should be taken up and accumulated if it is profitable to do business with the merchandise of a town‚Äôs marketplace,

original: gzung zhing bsags pas dang / khe med na mi gzung zhing mi bsags pa'i chos de lta bu gang yang dngos po yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir grong khyer gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung zhing bsags pas dang / khe med na mi gzung zhing mi bsags pa'i chos de lta bu gang yang dngos po yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir grong khyer gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or that should not be taken up and accumulated if it is not profitable.

original: grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: They do not engage in the activities of townspeople.

original: di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas /
translated: Because they abide in the limit of reality.üîΩThey do not see any phenomenon that increases

original: chos gang yang 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'phel ba'am /
translated: or decreases.

original: 'bri bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni yul gyi ljongs kyi gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bri bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni yul gyi ljongs kyi gtam gyis ma yengs par bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that they are not distracted by the gossip of the countryside.

original: don dam par chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin du stong par rtogs pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin du stong par rtogs pas /
translated: Ultimately, they realize that all phenomena are empty of the nature of the limit of reality.

original: yul gyi ljongs lo legs te /
analyzed: yul gyi ljongs lo legs te /
translated: Because he does not see any such thing as a country's landscape

original: 'phel ba'am / lo nyes te 'grib par 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang yod par mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phel ba'am / lo nyes te 'grib par 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang yod par mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: that would increase or decrease due to a good or bad harvest.

original: grong rdal gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grong rdal gyi gtam mi zer ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, he does not speak of the news of the town.

original: grong rdal zhes bya ba ni yul gyi ljongs la bya'o //
analyzed: grong rdal zhes bya ba ni yul gyi ljongs la bya'o //
translated: Here, town refers to a country's landscape.

original: bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas zhes @170a * //üîΩbya ba nas mthong ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa /
analyzed: bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas zhes @170a * // bya ba nas mthong ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa /
translated: He does not abide in being devoted to the application of the discourse on selfüîΩup to he does not abide in being devoted to the application of the discourse on the seer.

original: yod par lta ba'i gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod par lta ba'i gtam gyis ma yengs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that he is undistracted by the discourse on the view of the existence of the self, sentient beings, and so on imputed by tƒ´rthikas.

original: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag pa'i gtam la 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag pa'i gtam la 'jug cing /
translated: Otherwise, he is devoted to the application of the discourse on the perfection of wisdom and so on teaches that he engages in the correct discourse.

original: bsam pa dge ba la gnas na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba la gnas na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the demonstration that one should be known as an irreversible bodhisattva if one remains in a virtuous attitude.

original: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson zhing zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson zhing zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Otherwise, one is diligent in the application of the discourse of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i gtam la 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gtam la 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This explains the engagement in correct discourse.

original: gtam ci zer kyang rung sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzud pa'i gtam 'ba' zhig zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtam ci zer kyang rung sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzud pa'i gtam 'ba' zhig zer ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whatever discourse one engages in, one only engages in discourse that introduces sentient beings to the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One remains without being separated from the mental activity that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: One practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: One does not remain diligent in the application of bad wisdom.

original: bsam pa dge ba la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This explains the remaining in a virtuous attitude.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba'i bsam pa dang ma bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba'i bsam pa dang ma bral bar gnas te /
translated: He abides without ever being separated from the attitude of attention endowed with the knowledge of all things.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: He practices the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams yongs su spong na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams yongs su spong na /
translated: He abandons the resistances to the six perfections.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He should be known as an irreversible bodhisattva.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing chos 'dod pa yin gyi chos mi 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing chos 'dod pa yin gyi chos mi 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de /
translated: He practices the emptiness of all things, and he is devoted to the Dharma, not to non-Dharma.

original: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs kyang /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs kyang /
translated: This means that he realizes the ultimate emptiness of all things,

original: kun rdzob tu dam pa'i chos tshol ba la 'bad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dam pa'i chos tshol ba la 'bad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but he strives to seek the holy Dharma on the conventional level.

original: de chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing chos tha dad pa'i legs pa brjod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing chos tha dad pa'i legs pa brjod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He practices the Dharma-element, and he does not praise the excellence of sectarianism.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: That irreversible bodhisattva realizes that all phenomena are empty by nature,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig par rtogs pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig par rtogs pas /
translated: and that they are of one taste in the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos rnams la ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa tha dad du 'byed pa la dga' ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa tha dad du 'byed pa la dga' ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he does not delight in dividing up phenomena into different names and characteristics.

original: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @170b chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du sems pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @170b chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du sems pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He thinks of the blessed buddhas and the bodhisattva great beings as spiritual friends.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu theg pa dman pa la zhugs pas rnams la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu theg pa dman pa la zhugs pas rnams la /
translated: Unlike the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are engaged in the Lesser Vehicle,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi tshol bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi tshol bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he does not seek spiritual friends among them. He thinks of the buddhas and bodhisattvas as spiritual friends.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba 'god do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba 'god do //
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family who are in the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, he exhorts to the utmost, right and perfect enlightenment.

original: 'dul lo rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni theg pa dman pa la zhugs pa rnams kyang theg pa chen po la thabs sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa bstan pa ste /üîΩyang dag par bskul ba ni dang por gros 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul lo rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba ni theg pa dman pa la zhugs pa rnams kyang theg pa chen po la thabs sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa bstan pa ste / yang dag par bskul ba ni dang por gros 'debs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he trains them, he establishes them shows how he introduces even those who are in the Lesser Vehicle to the Great Vehicle by various means.üîΩExhortation is the initial advice.

original: 'god pa ni nyan cing sems su 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: 'god pa ni nyan cing sems su 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the introduction to listening and reflection.

original: 'dul ba ni nyes pa byung ba rnams 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni nyes pa byung ba rnams 'chos pa'o //
translated: Training is the correction of faults that arise.

original: rab tu gzhog pa ni phyis gzhan du mi 'gyur bar brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gzhog pa ni phyis gzhan du mi 'gyur bar brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the stabilization of the mind so that it does not later change.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bsnyen par byed cing zhes bya ba nas gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par ma zhugs shing /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bsnyen par byed cing zhes bya ba nas gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par ma zhugs shing /
translated: They approach the thus-gone ones, the worthy ones, the perfect buddhas, and so forth, up to they are born in places where the thus-gone ones, the worthy ones, the perfect buddhas are not present,üîΩwhere they are not alive and well, and where they do not teach the Dharma.

original: 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa der skyes te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral zhing sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa la brtson pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa der skyes te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral zhing sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa la brtson pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage shows how irreversible bodhisattvas are never separated from the appearance of buddhas and are diligent in pleasing the buddhas.

original: sems can rnams mig drang ba'i phyir thabs kyis 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams mig drang ba'i phyir thabs kyis 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas /
translated: In order to guide sentient beings, they are born in the desire realm through skillful means.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthu thob par byas nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthu thob par byas nas /
translated: Having attained the power of meditation on the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions,

original: de'i mthus gang na de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i gnas der skyes te /
analyzed: de'i mthus gang na de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i gnas der skyes te /
translated: By the power of that, he is born in a place where a TathƒÅgata is present in person.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par byed pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags de lta bu dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par byed pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags de lta bu dag dang ldan na /
translated: If he has those signs and tokens of pleasing the TathƒÅgatas,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: he should be known as a Bodhisattva irreversible from awakening.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, irreversible Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas pa ni /üîΩ'di snyam du bdag ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas pa ni / 'di snyam du bdag ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
translated: who stand in inner emptiness, up to stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,üîΩdo not think, ‚ÄòI am irreversible,

original: phyir mi ldog pa yin no snyam du yang mi byed @171a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa yin no snyam du yang mi byed @171a * //
translated: or I am not irreversible.‚Äô

original: de ; the tshom mi skye zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi sa la the tshom med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ; the tshom mi skye zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi sa la the tshom med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúhe does not give rise to doubt‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe has no uncertainty about his own stage‚Äù teaches that the irreversible bodhisattva has no doubt about his own stage.

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang // bsam gtan bzhi dang tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam mi byed de /
translated: Subhuti, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, has passed away, he does not think, ‚ÄúI shall not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.‚ÄùüîΩHe thinks, ‚ÄúI will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so zhes bya bas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshe snga phyi dran zhing byang chub kyi sems mi nyams pas
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so zhes bya bas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshe snga phyi dran zhing byang chub kyi sems mi nyams pas
translated: Thus, the irreversible Bodhisattva, remembering past and future lives, and not letting the mind of enlightenment deteriorate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches that he will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs shing /
translated: This is how that bodhisattva realizes that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: and attains forbearance for the nonarising of dharmas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is also realized to be empty of its own mark.
